summary.en: Resupervise means to supervise again, usually to fix issues or ensure quality.
summary.zh: resupervise 指“再次监督/重新监管”，多用于纠错或确保质量。

definition.en: to supervise again; to review and oversee someone’s work or process a second time (often to correct problems or improve quality)
definition.zh: 再次监督；重新检查并监管某人的工作或流程（常用于纠正问题或提升质量）

examples.en: After several mistakes were found, the manager decided to resupervise the entire project.
examples.zh: 发现多处错误后，经理决定重新监督整个项目。

examples.en: The new teacher had to resupervise the lab safety procedures with the class.
examples.zh: 新老师需要和班级一起再次监督（并落实）实验室安全流程。

extraExplanation: “resupervise”是由前缀 re-（再次、重新）+ supervise（监督）组成的构词。它在日常英语中不算常见，更自然的表达常用 “supervise again / re-check / oversee again / review the supervision of …” 等。若在正式文件或流程管理语境中，使用 “resupervise” 也可以显得简洁。

summary.en: Resupinate describes something (especially a flower or fungus) that is turned upside down or grows flat against a surface.
summary.zh: Resupinate 指（尤指花或真菌）倒置的，或贴伏在表面生长的。

definition.en: (Biology, especially botany/mycology) Turned upside down or lying flat against a surface, so the “upper” side faces downward; often used for flowers or fungi growing flat on wood or rock.
definition.zh: （生物学，尤指植物学/真菌学）倒置的；贴伏在表面生长的，使原本“上面”的一侧朝下；常用于描述花或真菌贴着木头、岩石平铺生长。

examples.en: Some orchids have resupinate flowers, meaning the bloom twists so the lip is on the bottom.
examples.zh: 有些兰花的花是倒置的（resupinate），也就是花会扭转，使唇瓣位于下方。

examples.en: The fungus formed a thin, resupinate crust on the underside of the log.
examples.zh: 这种真菌在木头的下侧形成了一层薄薄的贴伏“壳状”菌膜。

definition.en: (Less common) To become resupinate; to turn upside down (used mainly in scientific writing).
definition.zh: （较少见）变为倒置；翻转成倒置状态（多用于科学写作）。

examples.en: During development, the flower may resupinate as the stalk twists.
examples.zh: 在发育过程中，花梗扭转时花可能会变为倒置。

extraExplanation: 词源来自拉丁语 resupinatus，意为“仰翻/翻转”。在兰花里，resupinate 常指花在生长中旋转约 180°，让唇瓣（lip）朝下，便于昆虫传粉。
在真菌学里，resupinate 常用来形容“贴伏型/壳状”子实体：紧贴基质（如木材）扩展，看起来像一层薄薄的涂层或外皮。

summary.en: Resupinated describes something (especially a flower or fungus) that has become flipped or twisted so it faces the opposite way.
summary.zh: Resupinated 指（尤指花或真菌结构）经过翻转或扭转而呈倒置、朝向相反方向的状态。

definition.en: (Botany/Mycology) Turned upside down or twisted so the original upper surface becomes the lower surface (or faces outward).
definition.zh: （植物学/真菌学）倒置的；扭转而使原本的上表面变成下表面（或转到外侧）的。

examples.en: Some orchids have resupinated flowers, so the lip ends up on the bottom.
examples.zh: 一些兰花的花是倒置的，因此唇瓣最后会在下方。

examples.en: The fungus forms a resupinated fruiting body that lies flat on the wood.
examples.zh: 这种真菌形成贴伏在木头上的“倒置型”子实体。

extraExplanation: “resupinated”多见于专业语境（植物学、真菌学）。在兰花中常指花梗在发育过程中扭转约180度，使原本朝上的结构转到下面，便于传粉昆虫停靠。
在真菌学里，resupinate 常描述“贴伏型”子实体：子实体平铺在基质表面，产孢层（产生孢子的表面）暴露在外侧，而不是形成明显的菌盖。
词源来自拉丁语：re-（回、再）+ supinare（使仰卧/翻转），核心概念就是“翻转、倒置”。

summary.en: Resupination means turning back to a former position—most commonly, rotating the forearm so the palm faces up; in botany, it’s a twist that reorients a leaf or flower.
summary.zh: Resupination 指“转回/复位”；最常见的是前臂旋转让手心朝上；在植物学中指叶或花的扭转使其重新定向。

definition.en: the act or movement of turning something back to a previous position; especially rotating the forearm so the palm faces up (the opposite of pronation)
definition.zh: 复位；回旋；（尤指）前臂旋转使手心朝上（与 pronation“旋前”相反）

examples.en: In rehab, the therapist measured his range of resupination after the wrist injury.
examples.zh: 在康复治疗中，治疗师测量了他手腕受伤后的“旋后复位”活动范围。

examples.en: Try gentle resupination of the forearm so your palm faces the ceiling.
examples.zh: 尝试轻柔地旋后，让手心朝向天花板。

definition.en: (botany) a twisting or repositioning of a leaf or flower so that it ends up oriented differently, often turning “back” into an upright or functional position
definition.zh: （植物）叶或花的扭转/再定向，使其最终朝向改变，常见为“转回”到更合适的姿态

examples.en: Some orchids show resupination, twisting the flower so the lip ends up on the bottom.
examples.zh: 有些兰花会发生“复位扭转”，让花朵旋转后唇瓣位于下方。

extraExplanation: 在解剖学里，resupination 常用于描述前臂由“旋前”（手心向下）转回“旋后”（手心向上）的动作；常见搭配有 resupination movement / resupination range of motion。
在植物学里，resupination 常用来解释某些花（如兰花）在生长过程中发生的扭转，从而让花的结构处在更利于授粉的方向。

summary.en: Resupine means lying on your back with your face upward, often used in medical or exercise contexts.
summary.zh: resupine 指“仰卧、面朝上”，常用于医学或运动/瑜伽等语境。

definition.en: lying on your back with your face upward
definition.zh: 仰卧的；面朝上的

examples.en: After the yoga pose, lie resupine and relax your shoulders.
examples.zh: 做完瑜伽动作后，仰卧下来，放松肩膀。

examples.en: The patient was placed resupine for the examination.
examples.zh: 病人被安排成仰卧姿势以便检查。

definition.en: a person or animal lying on its back
definition.zh: 仰卧的人（或动物）

examples.en: The photographer asked the model to become a resupine for the next shot.
examples.zh: 摄影师让模特下一张换成仰卧姿势。

extraExplanation: “resupine”较常见于医学、解剖学与运动/瑜伽语境，日常口语里更常说“lying on your back”或“face up”。
词源来自拉丁语：re-（向后）+ supinus（仰卧的）。在一些技术写作中，它与“prone（俯卧，face down）”形成对比。

summary.en: “Resupplied” means supplied again with needed items after they ran low or ran out.
summary.zh: “resupplied”表示在物资不足或用尽后“再次补给/重新供给”。

definition.en: given new supplies to (a person, place, or organization) after supplies were used up; supplied again
definition.zh: 在物资用完或不足后，给（人、地点或组织）再次补给；重新供给

examples.en: The store was resupplied with bottled water after the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，这家商店又补货了瓶装水。

examples.en: The clinic was resupplied with masks and medicine.
examples.zh: 诊所重新补给了口罩和药品。

examples.en: After a week on the road, the hikers resupplied at a small town.
examples.zh: 在路上走了一周后，徒步者在一个小镇补给。

extraExplanation: “resupplied”是动词“resupply”的过去式/过去分词。常见于物流、救灾、医疗和军事语境：resupply troops（给部队补给）、resupply a base（给基地补给）。
常见搭配：be resupplied with + 物资（被补给了……）；resupply at + 地点（在……补给，偏美式户外/长途徒步语境）。

summary.en: “Resupplies” means additional supplies delivered again, or (as a verb) “resupplies” = supplies again.
summary.zh: “resupplies”可指“补给物资（复数）”，也可作动词表示“再次补给/补货”。

definition.en: (plural noun) additional supplies sent again to replace or add to what has been used (often food, fuel, ammunition, medicine, etc.)
definition.zh: （复数名词）补给物资；再次运送来的补充物资（常指食物、燃料、弹药、药品等）

examples.en: The hikers waited two days for resupplies of food and water.
examples.zh: 徒步者等了两天才等到食物和水的补给。

examples.en: After the storm, the island finally received resupplies by boat.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，这座岛终于通过船只收到了补给物资。

definition.en: (verb, third-person singular of “resupply”) to supply again; to provide more of something that has run low
definition.zh: （动词，resupply 的第三人称单数）再补给；在物资不足时再次提供补充

examples.en: The company resupplies the store every Friday.
examples.zh: 这家公司每周五给这家店补货。

examples.en: The helicopter resupplies the research team in the mountains.
examples.zh: 直升机给山里的研究团队运送补给。

extraExplanation: “resupply / resupplies”在新闻和军事语境里很常见，尤其指给前线、基地或受灾地区运送补给（如燃料、弹药、医疗物资）。在日常生活中也可指“补货/补给”，比如商店补货或旅行途中补给。

summary.en: Resupply means to supply again or a new delivery of needed goods, often used in travel or logistics contexts.
summary.zh: Resupply 指再次补给/重新供应，也可指一批新的补给物资，常用于旅行或后勤补给语境。

definition.en: to supply again; to provide more of something that has been used up
definition.zh: 再次补给；重新供应（已用完或不足的物资）

examples.en: The hikers returned to town to resupply with food and water.
examples.zh: 徒步旅行者回到镇上补给食物和水。

examples.en: We need to resupply the clinic with basic medicines before winter.
examples.zh: 我们需要在冬季前为诊所补充基本药品。

definition.en: a new supply or delivery of goods; the act of supplying again
definition.zh: 再次补给；补给物资；补给行为（也可作名词用）

examples.en: The store gets a resupply every Friday.
examples.zh: 这家店每周五都会进一批补货。

examples.en: The resupply of fuel was delayed by the storm.
examples.zh: 燃料补给因暴风雨而延误。

extraExplanation: “resupply”常见于旅行、徒步、露营、航运与军队后勤语境，强调把消耗掉的必需品（如食物、水、燃料、药品、弹药等）补回来。
词形上是 re-（再次）+ supply（供应）。在日常购物语境中，人们更常说 restock（补货），而 resupply 更偏“补给/后勤”感觉。

summary.en: Resupplying means supplying again—adding more supplies after they’ve been used.
summary.zh: Resupplying 指“再次补给/补充物资”，在消耗后再提供更多供应。

definition.en: to supply again; to provide more of something that has been used up (food, fuel, money, etc.)
definition.zh: 再次补给；在消耗后再提供更多（食物、燃料、资金等）

examples.en: The ship is resupplying at the port before continuing its journey.
examples.zh: 这艘船在港口补给后再继续航程。

examples.en: We’re resupplying the store with fresh vegetables every morning.
examples.zh: 我们每天早上给商店补充新鲜蔬菜。

definition.en: the act or process of supplying again (often used in logistics or the military)
definition.zh: 再次补给的行为或过程（常用于物流或军事语境）

examples.en: Resupplying is difficult during bad weather.
examples.zh: 恶劣天气下补给很困难。

examples.en: The team planned resupplying stops along the route.
examples.zh: 团队规划了沿途的补给点。

extraExplanation: “resupplying”是动词“resupply”的现在分词/动名词形式：re-（再、重新）+ supply（供应）。常见搭配有 resupply a base（给基地补给）、resupply troops（给部队补给）、resupply with food/fuel（补给食物/燃料）。在新闻或小说里常出现在战争、救灾、远航、登山探险等场景。

summary.en: Resupport means to support again, either emotionally/financially or by physically reinforcing something.
summary.zh: resupport 指“再次支持/重新支持”，可用于情感、资金等支持，也可用于对结构进行重新支撑加固。

definition.en: to support again; to give new help, money, strength, or approval to someone or something that needs it again
definition.zh: 再次支持；重新给予帮助、资金、力量或认可

examples.en: After the budget cuts, the city promised to resupport the public library next year.
examples.zh: 预算削减后，市政府承诺明年将再次支持公共图书馆。

examples.en: She resupported her friend during the second round of interviews.
examples.zh: 在第二轮面试期间，她再次支持了朋友。

definition.en: to provide support again to a structure or object (often in technical writing)
definition.zh: （常用于技术语境）对结构或物体重新加固/再次支撑

examples.en: Engineers resupported the bridge temporarily while repairs were made.
examples.zh: 在进行维修时，工程师对桥梁进行了临时重新支撑。

examples.en: The cracked beam was resupported with a metal brace.
examples.zh: 开裂的梁用金属支架重新支撑加固。

extraExplanation: “resupport”由前缀 re-（再次、重新）+ support 组成，意思通常很直观：把“支持”这件事做第二次或重新做一遍。日常英语里更常见的表达是 “support again / renew support / back again”。如果用于工程、建筑等技术语境，“resupport”会更自然一些。

summary.en: Resuppose means to assume or suppose something again, often as a renewed starting point for reasoning.
summary.zh: Resuppose 指“再次/重新假定”，常用于把某事重新当作推理或讨论的起点。

definition.en: to suppose again; to assume something once more, especially as a starting point for reasoning or discussion
definition.zh: 再次假定；重新假设（尤指把某事再次当作推理或讨论的前提）

examples.en: To explain the new data, we may need to resuppose a different cause.
examples.zh: 为了解释新数据，我们可能需要重新假设一个不同的原因。

examples.en: If we resuppose that the plan will fail, we can prepare a backup.
examples.zh: 如果我们重新假设计划会失败，我们就能准备一个备选方案。

extraExplanation: “resuppose”较少见，更常见的是用“suppose again / assume again”来表达同样意思。
构词：re-（再、重新）+ suppose（假定）。在学术写作里，有时会用它表示“重新把某个前提当作成立”。
注意不要和“presuppose（预先假定）”混淆：presuppose强调“先于表达/论证就默认成立”，resuppose强调“又一次/重新假定”。

summary.en: Resupposition means making an assumption again or restating a premise.
summary.zh: Resupposition 指“再次假定/重申前提”。

definition.en: the act of supposing or assuming something again; a renewed assumption, often used in formal or philosophical writing
definition.zh: 再次假定或再度设想；重新提出的前提（多用于正式或哲学/逻辑语境）

examples.en: The author’s argument depends on a resupposition that human nature is basically good.
examples.zh: 作者的论证依赖于一个重新提出的前提：人性基本上是善的。

examples.en: After new evidence appeared, they made a resupposition about what had happened that night.
examples.zh: 在出现新证据后，他们对那晚发生的事重新作出了假定。

extraExplanation: “resupposition”并不是日常高频词，更常见的表达是“assumption again / renewed assumption / re-assumption”或直接用“assumption（假设）”。
构词上：re-（再次）+ supposition（假定、推测）。在哲学、论证分析里，它可指把某个前提在新的讨论中“再一次当作成立”来使用。

summary.en: Resuppress means “to suppress again”—to control or put down something that returns.
summary.zh: resuppress 意为“再次压制”，把重新出现的事物再次控制或压下去。

definition.en: to suppress again; to put down or control something that has returned (such as feelings, memories, or protests).
definition.zh: 再次压制；把再次出现的事物（如情绪、记忆、抗议等）重新压下去、控制住。

examples.en: After the panic returned, she tried to resuppress her fear and keep speaking.
examples.zh: 恐慌再次袭来后，她努力把恐惧重新压下去，继续讲话。

examples.en: The government attempted to resuppress the protests after they flared up again.
examples.zh: 抗议再次爆发后，政府试图再度压制。

examples.en: He resuppressed the memory, but it kept coming back in dreams.
examples.zh: 他把那段记忆重新压下去，但它总在梦里回来。

extraExplanation: “resuppress”在现代英语里很少见，很多情况下母语者更常用“suppress again / re-suppress”（加连字符）来表达同样意思，或者直接用更自然的说法：例如“push it down again（再压下去）”“keep it under control（继续控制住）”。
前缀“re-”表示“再次”，加在“suppress（压制）”前面就形成“再次压制”的含义。写作中如果用该词，常见于强调“某种情绪/冲动/动荡又回来了，于是再次被压下去”的语境。

summary.en: Resuppression means suppressing something again, or a renewed period of suppression; it can also describe pushing resurfaced thoughts back out of awareness.
summary.zh: resuppression 指“再次压制/再度压抑”；也可用于心理学，表示把重新浮现的想法或情绪再次压回意识之外。

definition.en: the act of suppressing something again, or a renewed period of suppression after it returns or becomes visible
definition.zh: 再次压制；在事物重新出现或变得明显后，再度进入压制状态

examples.en: After the protests briefly returned, the government began a resuppression of public gatherings.
examples.zh: 抗议短暂回潮后，政府开始再次压制公众集会。

examples.en: The report warns that resuppression of the media could follow the election.
examples.zh: 报告警告称，选举后可能会出现对媒体的再次压制。

definition.en: (psychology) pushing an unwanted thought or feeling back out of awareness after it has resurfaced
definition.zh: （心理学）当不想要的想法或情绪再次浮现后，把它重新压回到意识之外

examples.en: In therapy, she noticed a cycle of remembering and resuppression.
examples.zh: 在治疗中，她注意到自己在“想起—再压下去”的循环里。

examples.en: Resuppression can make the emotion return more strongly later.
examples.zh: 再次压抑可能会让情绪在之后更强烈地反弹。

extraExplanation: “resuppression”不是非常常见的通用词，更常见的表达是“renewed suppression / re-suppression / suppression again”。在学术或评论写作里，它有时用来强调“压制发生了第二轮或再次启动”。
在心理学语境中，它可以和“repression（压抑）”相关联：某些内容曾浮现到意识层面，但又被人有意或无意地压回去。

summary.en: Resurface means to appear again (often said about memories, rumors, or problems), or to put a new surface on something like a road.
summary.zh: Resurface 指（记忆、传闻、问题等）再次出现/重新浮现，也可指给道路等重新铺面。

definition.en: To appear again or become noticeable again after being absent or forgotten.
definition.zh: （在消失、沉寂或被遗忘后）再次出现；重新浮现。

examples.en: Old rumors about the celebrity resurfaced online last week.
examples.zh: 上周，关于那位名人的旧传闻又在网上重新浮现。

examples.en: The pain resurfaced after she started training again.
examples.zh: 她恢复训练后，疼痛又出现了。

definition.en: To bring something back into attention or discussion; to make something appear again.
definition.zh: 使（某事）再次出现；让（话题/问题）重新被关注。

examples.en: The documentary resurfaced the debate about privacy.
examples.zh: 这部纪录片让关于隐私的争论再次升温。

examples.en: He resurfaced an old complaint during the meeting.
examples.zh: 他在会议上又提起了一项旧投诉。

definition.en: To put a new surface on a road, floor, or another area.
definition.zh: 给（道路、地面等）重新铺面；重铺。

examples.en: The city plans to resurface the highway this summer.
examples.zh: 市政府计划今年夏天重铺这条高速公路。

examples.en: They resurfaced the basketball court to make it safer.
examples.zh: 他们重铺了篮球场的地面，让它更安全。

extraExplanation: “resurface”= re-（再次）+ surface（表面/浮出水面）。除了“重铺路面”的字面意思外，更常见的是比喻用法：回忆、情绪、丑闻、争议等“又冒出来”。
常见搭配：resurface online（在网上再度出现）、memories resurfaced（记忆浮现）、issues/problems resurfaced（问题再现）、resurface a road（重铺道路）。

summary.en: “Resurfaced” means either (1) appeared again, or (2) was given a new surface (especially roads).
summary.zh: “Resurfaced”常指（1）再次出现/重新浮现；或（2）重新铺面（尤指道路）。

definition.en: appeared again after being hidden, forgotten, or inactive (past tense/past participle of “resurface”)
definition.zh: （resurface 的过去式/过去分词）再次出现；在被隐藏、遗忘或沉寂后重新浮现

examples.en: Old memories resurfaced when I visited my hometown.
examples.zh: 我回到家乡时，许多旧回忆又浮现了。

examples.en: The issue resurfaced during the meeting.
examples.zh: 这个问题在会议中又被提起/又冒了出来。

definition.en: was repaired by putting a new surface on something, especially a road (past tense/past participle of “resurface”)
definition.zh: （resurface 的过去式/过去分词）给……重新铺面/重铺（尤指道路）

examples.en: The city resurfaced the main road last summer.
examples.zh: 市政府去年夏天把主干道重新铺了一遍。

examples.en: Our driveway was resurfaced to fix cracks.
examples.zh: 我们的车道重新铺面以修补裂缝。

definition.en: having appeared again or become noticeable again
definition.zh: 重新出现的；再度引起注意的

examples.en: There were resurfaced tensions between the two teams.
examples.zh: 两队之间又出现了新的紧张关系。

extraExplanation: “resurface”字面意思是“重新到表面”。用于情绪/回忆/争议时，常带有“本来压下去但又冒出来”的感觉；用于道路工程时则是很具体的“重铺路面”。
写作中常见搭配：resurfaced memories（再次浮现的记忆）、resurfaced fears（旧恐惧复发）、the scandal resurfaced（丑闻再度曝光）。

summary.en: “Resurfaces” means (1) appears again, or (2) is covered with a new surface, especially a road.
summary.zh: “resurfaces”表示（1）再次出现/重新浮现；（2）重新铺面（尤指道路）。

definition.en: to appear again or become noticeable again after being absent for a time (often for memories, problems, news, or feelings)
definition.zh: （在消失一段时间后）再次出现；重新浮现（常指记忆、问题、新闻或情绪）

examples.en: Old rumors resurfaced during the election.
examples.zh: 旧谣言在选举期间又重新冒出来了。

examples.en: The pain resurfaced after I stopped taking the medicine.
examples.zh: 我停药后疼痛又复发了。

examples.en: A childhood memory resurfaced when I heard that song.
examples.zh: 听到那首歌时，一段童年记忆又浮现出来。

definition.en: to put a new surface on something (especially a road, driveway, or floor)
definition.zh: 给……重新铺面；重新铺设（尤指道路、车道或地面）

examples.en: The city resurfaced the main road last summer.
examples.zh: 市政府去年夏天把主干道重新铺设了一遍。

examples.en: They plan to resurface the driveway to fix the cracks.
examples.zh: 他们打算重铺车道来修复裂缝。

extraExplanation: “resurfaces”是动词“resurface”的第三人称单数（he/she/it resurfaces）。常见搭配：an issue resurfaces（问题再现）、memories resurface（记忆浮现）、resurface a road（重铺道路）。
词缀提示：re- 表示“再次”，surface 表示“表面”。所以 resurface 字面意思是“再次到表面/再次铺表面”。

summary.en: Resurfacing means either putting a new surface on something (often roads) or something appearing again after being gone or quiet.
summary.zh: Resurfacing既可指（多用于道路）重新铺设表面，也可指事物在消失/沉寂后再次出现或重新浮现。

definition.en: the process of putting a new surface on something (especially a road) to repair it and make it smooth again
definition.zh: （尤指道路）重新铺设路面/表面，使其修复并变平整的过程

examples.en: The city scheduled road resurfacing for next month.
examples.zh: 市政府安排下个月进行道路重新铺设工程。

examples.en: Resurfacing the driveway will reduce potholes and dust.
examples.zh: 重新铺设车道能减少坑洞和灰尘。

definition.en: coming back or appearing again after being forgotten, hidden, or inactive
definition.zh: （被遗忘、隐藏或沉寂之后）再次出现/重新浮现

examples.en: Old rumors keep resurfacing online.
examples.zh: 旧谣言不断在网上重新冒出来。

examples.en: His shoulder pain is resurfacing after the long trip.
examples.zh: 长途旅行后，他的肩痛又复发了。

examples.en: Memories of that day started resurfacing when she heard the song.
examples.zh: 她听到那首歌时，那天的记忆开始重新浮现。

definition.en: related to the act of putting a new surface on something
definition.zh: 与重新铺设（路面/表面）有关的

examples.en: Resurfacing work caused traffic delays downtown.
examples.zh: 重新铺设路面的施工导致市中心交通延误。

extraExplanation: “Resurfacing”在新闻里很常见：字面上多指道路工程（road resurfacing），引申义则常用来形容“旧问题/旧传闻/旧伤痛”再次出现（a problem resurfaces）。
对应的动词原形是resurface：re-（再次）+ surface（表面/浮出水面），因此既可指“重新铺面”，也可指“重新出现/浮现”。

summary.en: Resurgam is a Latin phrase meaning “I shall rise again,” often used to express renewal or resurrection.
summary.zh: Resurgam 是拉丁语短语，意为“我将再度崛起／复起”，常用来表达重生、复苏或复活的希望。

definition.en: (Latin) “I shall rise again.” Used as a motto or inscription to express hope, renewal, or resurrection (often in religious or memorial contexts).
definition.zh: （拉丁语）“我将再度崛起／我将复起。”常作格言或铭文，用来表达希望、重生或复活（常见于宗教或纪念语境）。

examples.en: The word “Resurgam” was carved on the memorial as a sign of hope after the tragedy.
examples.zh: 纪念碑上刻着“Resurgam”，象征悲剧之后的希望。

examples.en: Their school chose “Resurgam” as a motto to mean learning from failure and starting again.
examples.zh: 他们学校选用“Resurgam”作校训，寓意从失败中学习并重新开始。

definition.en: By extension, a title or slogan meaning “a comeback” or “a return to life/strength.”
definition.zh: 引申义：用作标题或口号，表示“东山再起／复苏／重振”。

examples.en: The campaign was called “Resurgam,” promising a fresh start for the community.
examples.zh: 这项运动名为“Resurgam”，承诺为社区带来新的开始。

examples.en: After years away from music, her new album felt like a resurgam.
examples.zh: 离开乐坛多年后，她的新专辑像一次“复起”。

extraExplanation: “Resurgam”来自拉丁语动词 resurgere（再次站起、复起）的第一人称将来时，字面意思是“我将再次起来”。在英文写作中常作为拉丁语短语保留原拼写，正式场合有时会用斜体或首字母大写。

summary.en: Resurge means to rise or become active/popular again after a decline.
summary.zh: Resurge 指在衰退或沉寂之后再次回升、复苏或再度兴起。

definition.en: to become active, strong, or popular again after a period of weakness or decline; to rise again
definition.zh: 在一段低迷或衰退之后再次变得活跃、强大或流行；复苏；再起

examples.en: After a few quiet years, interest in vinyl records resurged.
examples.zh: 沉寂了几年之后，人们对黑胶唱片的兴趣又复苏了。

examples.en: Tourism is expected to resurge next summer.
examples.zh: 预计明年夏天旅游业会回暖。

examples.en: Old tensions can resurge if problems aren’t addressed.
examples.zh: 如果问题得不到解决，旧矛盾可能会再度浮现。

definition.en: to rise again (often of feelings, memories, or problems)
definition.zh: （多指情绪、记忆或问题）再次出现；再度涌现

examples.en: As she walked past the school, painful memories resurged.
examples.zh: 她走过那所学校时，痛苦的记忆又涌上心头。

examples.en: Doubts resurged during the final days of the project.
examples.zh: 在项目最后几天，疑虑又重新出现了。

extraExplanation: “resurge”由前缀 re-（再次）+ surge（激增、涌动）组成，语感上常用于“回升、反弹、再度兴起”，比“return”更强调像浪潮一样“再度涌起”的势头。
常见搭配：resurge in popularity（重新流行起来），resurge after a decline（下滑后回升），fears/violence/disease resurges（恐惧/暴力/疾病再度出现）。注意它通常不接宾语（不说 *resurge something*）。

summary.en: “Resurged” means something became active, strong, or popular again after fading or stopping.
summary.zh: “resurged”表示某事在减弱或停止后再次变得活跃、有力或流行起来。

definition.en: (of something that had decreased or stopped) to become active, popular, or strong again; to rise again
definition.zh: （曾经减弱或停止的事物）再次活跃/流行/强烈起来；重新兴起

examples.en: Interest in vinyl records has resurged in recent years.
examples.zh: 近年来，人们对黑胶唱片的兴趣又重新兴起。

examples.en: After a brief calm, the violence resurged overnight.
examples.zh: 短暂平静之后，暴力事件在一夜之间再次爆发。

examples.en: Old fears resurged when she heard the news.
examples.zh: 她听到消息时，旧日的恐惧再次涌上心头。

definition.en: to increase again after going down; to rise back up
definition.zh: （下降后）再次上升；回升

examples.en: Prices dipped in the spring but resurged by summer.
examples.zh: 价格在春季下滑，但到夏季又回升了。

examples.en: The team’s confidence resurged after the comeback win.
examples.zh: 球队在逆转获胜后信心又回来了。

extraExplanation: “resurged”是动词“resurge”的过去式/过去分词。常见搭配：resurge in interest（兴趣复燃）、resurge of violence/disease（暴力/疾病再度爆发）、fears/rumors resurged（恐惧/谣言再起）。
词源上由前缀 re-（再次）+ surge（涌起、激增）构成，因此语感上强调“再次涌现/回潮”。

summary.en: Resurgence means a comeback—something becoming active, strong, or popular again after fading.
summary.zh: Resurgence 指“回潮/复兴/复苏”，即在一段低迷之后再次变得活跃、有力或受欢迎。

definition.en: a return to life, activity, popularity, or strength after a period of decline
definition.zh: （在一段衰落之后）复兴；复苏；再度兴起

examples.en: There has been a resurgence of interest in vinyl records.
examples.zh: 人们对黑胶唱片的兴趣再次兴起。

examples.en: After the recession, the city saw a resurgence in tourism.
examples.zh: 经济衰退之后，这座城市的旅游业出现了复苏。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：resurgence 来自 re-（再次）+ surge（汹涌、激增），所以常用来形容“重新涌现/回潮”的趋势或现象。
常见搭配：a resurgence of + 名词（interest/violence/disease/nationalism 等）；see/experience a resurgence（出现/经历复兴）。
语气与用法：可用于积极（文化、经济复兴）也可用于消极（暴力、疫情回潮），语境决定态度。

summary.en: Resurgences (plural of resurgence) means comebacks or renewed rises after a decline.
summary.zh: resurgences（resurgence的复数）指在衰退之后的复兴、回潮或再度上升。

definition.en: A return to life, activity, popularity, or strength after a period of decline (a comeback or revival).
definition.zh: 在一段衰退之后重新出现、复兴或再度兴盛（回潮、复苏）。

examples.en: There has been a resurgence of interest in vinyl records.
examples.zh: 黑胶唱片的兴趣又出现了回潮。

examples.en: The city experienced an economic resurgence after years of stagnation.
examples.zh: 这座城市在多年停滞后经历了经济复苏。

definition.en: A renewed increase, especially one that happens again (often used for problems like violence or inflation).
definition.zh: 再次出现的增长或上升（常用于暴力、通胀等问题的“再度抬头”）。

examples.en: Officials are worried about a resurgence in violence.
examples.zh: 官员们担心暴力事件再度抬头。

examples.en: Inflation showed a resurgence in the second half of the year.
examples.zh: 通货膨胀在下半年再次上升。

definition.en: A return or reappearance of a disease after improvement (medical use).
definition.zh: （医学）疾病在好转后再次复发。

examples.en: Doctors monitored the patient for any resurgence of symptoms.
examples.zh: 医生监测病人是否出现症状复发。

extraExplanation: “resurgences”是名词复数，单数是“resurgence”。常见搭配有：a resurgence of interest/violence/inflation（对……的兴趣回潮/暴力再起/通胀再度上升）。
词源提示：re-（再）+ surge（涌起、激增），字面意思是“再次涌起”。在新闻与学术写作中很常用，语气比“comeback”更正式。

summary.en: Resurgency means a revival or renewed rise after a decline; “resurgence” is more common.
summary.zh: Resurgency 指衰落后的复苏或再度兴起；更常用的名词是 resurgence。

definition.en: a revival or renewed growth of something, especially after a period of decline
definition.zh: （尤指衰落后）复苏；再度兴起；重新增长

examples.en: There has been a resurgency of interest in vinyl records.
examples.zh: 黑胶唱片的兴趣出现了再度兴起。

examples.en: The city hopes for an economic resurgency after years of slow growth.
examples.zh: 这座城市希望在多年增长缓慢后迎来经济复苏。

extraExplanation: “resurgency”来自“resurgent”（复苏的、再起的），更常见的名词是“resurgence”。在新闻、社会议题和经济语境里，人们通常说“a resurgence of …”（……的再度兴起）。
常见搭配：a resurgency/resurgence of violence（暴力回潮）、a resurgency/resurgence in tourism（旅游业回暖）、political resurgency（政治势力再起）。

summary.en: Resurgent describes something that becomes strong, active, or popular again after declining.
summary.zh: Resurgent 指某事物在衰退后重新变得强劲、活跃或流行。

definition.en: becoming active, strong, or popular again after a period of weakness or decline; rising again
definition.zh: 在一段低迷或衰落之后再度活跃、强大或流行；复苏的；再起的

examples.en: There is resurgent interest in learning traditional crafts.
examples.zh: 人们对学习传统手工艺的兴趣正在复苏。

examples.en: The team showed resurgent confidence in the second half.
examples.zh: 这支球队在下半场展现出重新振作的自信。

examples.en: Scientists are worried about resurgent cases of the disease.
examples.zh: 科学家担心这种疾病病例再次回升。

extraExplanation: “resurgent”来自拉丁语词根 sur-（上升）相关，核心画面是“再次涌起/再度升起”。常用于新闻和学术语境：resurgent economy（复苏的经济）、resurgent nationalism（重新抬头的民族主义）、resurgent violence（暴力再起）。
近义词细微差别：resurgent 强调“恢复并再度增强/回升”；renewed 更偏“重新开始/再度出现”；revived 常用于“被唤醒/被恢复”，也可用于艺术、传统等。

summary.en: “Resurges” means becomes strong or active again after declining.
summary.zh: “resurges”表示在减弱或消退后再次变强、回升或再度活跃。

definition.en: (of something that had weakened or disappeared) to become strong, active, or popular again
definition.zh: （曾减弱或消失的事物）再次变强、重新活跃或重新流行

examples.en: Flu cases often resurge in winter.
examples.zh: 流感病例常常在冬季再次增多。

examples.en: After a brief pause, public interest resurges.
examples.zh: 短暂平静之后，公众兴趣又重新升温。

examples.en: Old fears can resurge during stressful times.
examples.zh: 在压力大的时候，旧的恐惧感可能会再次涌上心头。

definition.en: to rise up again; to reappear after going down
definition.zh: 再次上升；在下降后重新出现

examples.en: Prices may dip and then resurge later in the year.
examples.zh: 价格可能先下跌，然后在年内晚些时候再度回升。

examples.en: The river level resurges after heavy rain upstream.
examples.zh: 上游暴雨后，河流水位再次上涨。

extraExplanation: “resurges”是动词“resurge”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it resurges）。常用于新闻与学术语境：cases/infections/violence/tensions/interest resurge。
常见名词形式是“resurgence”（复苏、回潮、再度兴起），如：a resurgence of nationalism（民族主义的回潮）。
与“surge”相比，“resurge”强调“再次”出现或回升（re- 的含义）。

summary.en: “Resurging” means rising or becoming active again after a decline.
summary.zh: “Resurging”指在低迷之后再次上升或再度活跃。

definition.en: increasing or becoming active again after a period of decline; rising again
definition.zh: 在一段低迷后再次增长或变得活跃；再度兴起

examples.en: There is resurging interest in learning traditional crafts.
examples.zh: 人们对学习传统手工艺的兴趣正在再度升温。

examples.en: The city is facing resurging flu cases this winter.
examples.zh: 这个冬天该城市正面临流感病例回升。

examples.en: After a quiet year, the team’s confidence is resurging.
examples.zh: 沉寂了一年后，球队的信心正在回升。

definition.en: the present participle of “resurge”: to rise again or become strong/active again
definition.zh: “resurge”的现在分词：再次上升；重新变强或变得活跃

examples.en: Tourism is resurging as travel restrictions ease.
examples.zh: 随着旅行限制放宽，旅游业正在复苏。

extraExplanation: “resurge”由前缀 re-（再次）+ surge（激增、涌动）构成，因此常用于“在下降/沉寂之后又回升”的语境，尤其常见于新闻写作：resurging cases/violence/inflation/interest 等。
用法上，“resurging”常作定语（resurging demand 回升的需求）或作表语（Demand is resurging. 需求正在回升）。和“recovering（恢复）”相比，“resurging”更强调“再次上冲、重新变得强烈”。

summary.en: “Resurprise” means “surprise again,” but it’s rare; “re-surprise” or “surprise again” is more common.
summary.zh: “resurprise”意为“再次使惊讶”，但很少见；更常用的是“re-surprise”或“surprise again”。

definition.en: to surprise someone again; to cause someone to feel surprised a second time (rare or nonstandard in modern English).
definition.zh: 再次使某人惊讶；让某人第二次感到惊讶（现代英语中较少见或不太规范）。

examples.en: The ending didn’t just surprise me—it re-surprised me when I watched it again.
examples.zh: 结局不只是让我惊讶——我再看一遍时又再次被惊到。

examples.en: It’s hard to re-surprise an audience that already knows the twist.
examples.zh: 观众已经知道反转后，就很难再让他们“再次惊讶”。

extraExplanation: “resurprise”并不是常见标准词，更自然的写法通常是带连字符的“re-surprise”，或直接用“surprise again / surprise someone anew”。
在正式写作里，建议用更常见的表达：例如“astonish again（再次使震惊）”“take someone by surprise again（再次出其不意）”。

summary.en: Resurrect means to bring back to life or to bring something back after it was gone or forgotten.
summary.zh: Resurrect 指“使复活/苏醒”，也指“让消失或被遗忘的事物重新出现、复兴”。

definition.en: to bring someone back to life; to revive
definition.zh: 使（某人）复活；使苏醒

examples.en: In the story, the hero is resurrected by magic.
examples.zh: 在故事里，英雄被魔法复活了。

examples.en: Doctors managed to resurrect him after his heart stopped for a moment.
examples.zh: 他的心脏短暂停止后，医生设法把他抢救了回来。

definition.en: to bring back something that was lost or forgotten; to make something active or popular again
definition.zh: 使（失去/被遗忘的事物）重现；使复兴、重新流行

examples.en: The museum is trying to resurrect interest in traditional crafts.
examples.zh: 博物馆正试图重新唤起人们对传统手工艺的兴趣。

examples.en: She resurrected an old family recipe for the holiday dinner.
examples.zh: 她在节日晚餐时把一道老家传食谱重新做了出来。

definition.en: to come back to life or become active again
definition.zh: 复活；重新出现；再次活跃起来

examples.en: Old rumors sometimes resurrect when people feel uncertain.
examples.zh: 当人们感到不安时，旧谣言有时会再次出现。

examples.en: After a long break, his passion for music resurrected.
examples.zh: 休息很久后，他对音乐的热情又回来了。

extraExplanation: “resurrect”常见于宗教与文学语境，尤其与基督教中的“复活”概念相关；在日常英语里也很常用来表示“让旧事物/旧兴趣重新流行或再度出现”。
词源来自拉丁语前缀 re-（再次）+ surgere（升起、起身），所以核心意象是“再次站起来/重新起来”。

summary.en: Resurrected means “brought back to life” or, more commonly in everyday use, “revived/brought back into use or attention.”
summary.zh: resurrected 表示“复活的”，也常引申为“复兴的、重新启用/重提的”。

definition.en: brought back to life; made alive again (literally or in stories).
definition.zh: 复活的；起死回生的（字面义或故事中）。

examples.en: In the story, the hero was resurrected after three days.
examples.zh: 在故事里，英雄三天后复活了。

examples.en: Many Christians believe Jesus was resurrected.
examples.zh: 许多基督徒相信耶稣复活了。

definition.en: brought back into use, attention, or importance; revived.
definition.zh: 被重新启用/重提/恢复重要性的；复兴的。

examples.en: The city resurrected an old festival to attract visitors.
examples.zh: 这座城市重启了一个古老的节日来吸引游客。

examples.en: She resurrected the project after months of silence.
examples.zh: 沉寂数月后，她重新启动了这个项目。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “resurrect”: to bring back to life or to revive something from the past.
definition.zh: “resurrect”的过去式/过去分词：使复活；使复兴，使重新出现。

examples.en: Scientists resurrected the debate with new evidence.
examples.zh: 科学家用新证据让这场争论重新出现。

examples.en: He resurrected an old song and made it popular again.
examples.zh: 他把一首老歌重新带火了。

extraExplanation: “resurrect”常见于宗教与文学语境（如“the Resurrection”复活节相关概念），也常被引申用于“让旧事物重新流行/重新启动”。
在日常口语里，比起“resurrected”，人们更常说“brought back,” “revived,” “restarted”等，更自然、更不带宗教色彩。

summary.en: “Resurrectible” means able to be brought back to life, or (figuratively) able to be revived or restored.
summary.zh: “resurrectible”指“可复活的”，也可引申为“可复兴、可恢复的”。

definition.en: able to be brought back to life; capable of resurrection
definition.zh: 可复活的；能够复生的

examples.en: In some religions, the body is believed to be resurrectible after death.
examples.zh: 在一些宗教中，人们相信身体在死亡后是可以复活的。

examples.en: The novel treats the hero as resurrectible, returning again and again in different forms.
examples.zh: 这部小说把主人公写成“可复活”的，一次次以不同形式回归。

definition.en: (figurative) able to be revived, restored, or brought back into use
definition.zh: （比喻）可复兴的；可恢复的；可重新启用的

examples.en: The old tradition isn’t dead—it’s resurrectible with community support.
examples.zh: 这个古老传统并未消亡——在社区支持下仍可复兴。

examples.en: With the right funding, the project is resurrectible.
examples.zh: 只要资金到位，这个项目就能起死回生。

extraExplanation: “resurrectible”较少见，更常见的表达是“capable of being resurrected / revivable（可复活的／可恢复的）”。
词形上由“resurrect（使复活；使复兴）+ -ible（可……的）”构成，-ible常表示“能够被……（动词）”。
语境上既可用于宗教/神学（复活、来世），也常用于比喻意义（传统、项目、希望等“复兴/起死回生”）。

summary.en: Resurrecting means bringing something back—either literally back to life or, more commonly, bringing back an old idea, product, or interest.
summary.zh: Resurrecting 指让某物重新回来——字面上是复活，更常见是让旧事物、想法、产品或兴趣重新流行/恢复运作。

definition.en: bringing something back to life or making it active, successful, or used again after it had ended or been forgotten
definition.zh: 使某事物“复活”、重新活跃、重新成功或重新被使用（在结束/被遗忘之后）

examples.en: The company is resurrecting an old product line with a modern design.
examples.zh: 这家公司正用现代设计让一条旧产品线“复活”。

examples.en: She spent years resurrecting interest in traditional folk music.
examples.zh: 她花了多年让人们对传统民间音乐的兴趣重新兴起。

definition.en: bringing a dead person back to life (often used in religious, fantasy, or dramatic contexts)
definition.zh: 使死人复生（常见于宗教、奇幻或戏剧性的语境）

examples.en: In the story, the wizard is resurrecting the fallen hero.
examples.zh: 在故事里，巫师正在让倒下的英雄复活。

examples.en: Some religions teach that God is resurrecting the dead at the end of time.
examples.zh: 一些宗教教义认为，在末日上帝会使死人复活。

extraExplanation: “resurrecting”是动词resurrect的现在分词/动名词形式。日常英语里更常用来比喻“让某事重获生机/重新流行”，不一定与死亡有关。
词源来自拉丁语re-（再）+ surgere（起来）。在文化语境中，它常与宗教里的“复活”概念相关，但在商业、科技、艺术中也很常见，如resurrecting a tradition / an old debate / a project.

summary.en: Resurrection means rising from the dead (especially in Christianity) or, more generally, bringing something back or seeing it return.
summary.zh: Resurrection 指“复活”（尤其基督教语境），也可泛指“复兴/重现”，即让某事物回归或再次出现。

definition.en: (often capitalized) In Christianity, the act of rising from the dead; especially Jesus Christ coming back to life after death.
definition.zh: （常大写）在基督教中，死而复生；尤指耶稣死后复活。

examples.en: Christians celebrate the Resurrection at Easter.
examples.zh: 基督徒在复活节庆祝耶稣的复活。

examples.en: The story of the Resurrection is central to Christian faith.
examples.zh: 复活的故事是基督教信仰的核心。

definition.en: The act of bringing something back to life, use, attention, or popularity; a revival.
definition.zh: 使某事物“重现/复兴”；重新启用、重新流行或重新受到关注。

examples.en: There’s been a resurrection of interest in vinyl records.
examples.zh: 人们对黑胶唱片的兴趣出现了“复兴”。

examples.en: The city planned the resurrection of the old theater as a community arts center.
examples.zh: 这座城市计划把老剧院“复活”，改造成社区艺术中心。

definition.en: A person or thing that seems to come back after being gone, forgotten, or thought finished.
definition.zh: （比喻）消失后又出现、被遗忘后又回来的事物或人。

examples.en: His sudden return felt like a resurrection from the past.
examples.zh: 他的突然归来像是从过去“复活”了。

examples.en: The band’s reunion was a kind of resurrection for longtime fans.
examples.zh: 这支乐队的重聚对老粉丝来说是一种“复活”。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：resurrection 来自拉丁语 *resurgere*（再次升起、再站起来），因此既可指宗教意义的“复活”，也常用于比喻“复兴、再度出现”。
文化/文学用法：在英语里 The Resurrection 常作为专有名词，特指耶稣复活；在文学与媒体中也常用来表达“从失败中强势回归”或“旧事物再度流行”的意象。

summary.en: A formal adjective meaning “connected to resurrection,” often used in Christian or literary contexts.
summary.zh: 较正式的形容词，表示“与复活有关”，常见于基督教或文学语境。

definition.en: Related to the resurrection (especially the rising of Jesus from the dead) or to the idea of coming back to life.
definition.zh: 与“复活”有关的（尤指耶稣从死里复活），或与“死而复生/重生”的观念有关的。

examples.en: Easter is the central resurrectional celebration in many Christian churches.
examples.zh: 在许多基督教会中，复活节是最核心的“复活”庆典。

examples.en: The poem uses resurrectional imagery to suggest hope after loss.
examples.zh: 这首诗用“复活”的意象来暗示失去后的希望。

extraExplanation: “resurrectional”较正式、较少见，多用于宗教、神学、文学评论等语境。日常英语里更常说“about the resurrection”或用更常见的形容词“resurrection”（如 resurrection story / resurrection hope）。
词源上来自“resurrection（复活）+ -al（……的）”。在文学中，它常与“imagery（意象）”“motif（母题）”“theme（主题）”“symbolism（象征）”等搭配，表达“死后重生、经历苦难后复兴”的含义。

summary.en: Resurrectionary usually means “related to resurrection,” and historically it can also mean a grave-robber who stole bodies for dissection.
summary.zh: Resurrectionary 通常表示“与复活有关的”；在历史语境中也可指“盗挖尸体供解剖的盗尸者”。

definition.en: Relating to resurrection—the act of rising from the dead or coming back to life (often in religious or literary contexts).
definition.zh: 与“复活/死而复生”有关的（常见于宗教或文学语境）。

examples.en: The novel uses resurrectionary imagery to suggest hope after tragedy.
examples.zh: 这部小说用“复活”的意象来表达悲剧之后的希望。

examples.en: In Easter traditions, resurrectionary themes are common.
examples.zh: 在复活节传统中，“复活”主题很常见。

definition.en: (Historical, chiefly British) A person who stole corpses from graves for dissection; a “resurrectionist” or body snatcher.
definition.zh: （历史用法，主要见于英国）盗挖尸体供解剖的人；“盗尸者”。

examples.en: The newspaper reported that resurrectionaries had been seen near the churchyard at night.
examples.zh: 报纸报道说，夜里有人在教堂墓地附近看到盗尸者出没。

examples.en: Families guarded fresh graves to keep resurrectionaries away.
examples.zh: 家属守护新坟，以防盗尸者下手。

extraExplanation: “resurrectionary”作名词时，多出现在18—19世纪英国的社会背景：当时医学院对解剖遗体的需求很大，但合法来源不足，于是出现了“盗尸者”（也常叫resurrectionist）。因此这个词带有阴暗、犯罪、哥特式文学的气息，在历史小说或维多利亚时代题材中更常见。
词根提示：resurrection（复活）+ -ary（表示“与……有关的”）。形容词用法常用于修辞，强调“死而复生/重生”的象征意义。

summary.en: A resurrectioner is a historical term for a grave robber who stole bodies to sell for medical dissection.
summary.zh: resurrectioner 是历史用语，指盗掘坟墓偷尸体并卖给医学院解剖的人。

definition.en: a person who stole dead bodies from graves to sell to medical schools for dissection (especially in Britain in the 1700s–1800s)
definition.zh: （尤指18—19世纪英国）盗掘坟墓、偷走尸体并卖给医学院用于解剖的人

examples.en: In the 1800s, fear of resurrectioners made some families guard graves at night.
examples.zh: 在19世纪，人们害怕“盗尸者”，有些家庭会在夜里守墓。

examples.en: The novel describes a resurrectioner bribing a gravedigger to get a fresh body.
examples.zh: 小说描写了一名盗尸者贿赂掘墓人以获得一具“新鲜”的尸体。

examples.en: The museum exhibit explains how resurrectioners supplied cadavers for anatomy lessons.
examples.zh: 博物馆展览解释了盗尸者如何为解剖课提供尸体来源。

extraExplanation: “resurrectioner”这个词带有强烈的历史色彩，源于把尸体从坟墓里“复活”（resurrection）般带走的讽刺说法；并不表示让人真正复活。
在18—19世纪，医学解剖对尸体需求很大，但合法来源不足，于是出现“body snatching（盗尸）”。英国1832年的《解剖法案》（Anatomy Act）扩大了合法供体来源，才逐渐减少此类犯罪。
相关历史事件常与“Burke and Hare”案一起被提及：他们不仅盗尸，甚至杀人以卖尸体，导致公众对解剖与“盗尸者”的恐惧加深。

summary.en: A rare, nonstandard way to say “resurrecting”—bringing something back to life or use.
summary.zh: 一种少见的非标准说法，意思相当于“resurrecting”：让某物复活或恢复使用。

definition.en: (Nonstandard) bringing someone or something back to life, activity, or attention; used like the -ing form of “resurrect.”
definition.zh: （非标准用法）使某人或某物“复活”、恢复运作或重新受到关注；相当于动词“resurrect”的 -ing 形式。

examples.en: They joked about “resurrectioning” an old computer by replacing the hard drive.
examples.zh: 他们开玩笑说要通过更换硬盘把一台旧电脑“复活”。

examples.en: The museum is “resurrectioning” interest in the artist with a new exhibition.
examples.zh: 博物馆通过新展览让人们对这位艺术家的兴趣“再度复活”。

extraExplanation: “resurrectioning”在标准英语里很少见，常见且更自然的写法是 **resurrecting**（动词resurrect的现在分词/动名词）。
这个拼法有时是口语化、玩笑式或误写，把名词 **resurrection（复活）** 误当作动词来加 -ing。正式写作建议用 **resurrecting**；名词用 **resurrection**。

summary.en: Resurrectionism is the historical practice of stealing bodies from graves to sell for medical dissection and anatomy study.
summary.zh: Resurrectionism 指历史上为医学解剖与解剖学研究而掘墓盗尸并出售遗体的行为。

definition.en: the practice (especially in the 18th–19th centuries) of secretly digging up corpses to sell them for medical study and dissection; “body-snatching.”
definition.zh: （尤指18—19世纪）秘密挖掘尸体并卖给医学院用于解剖研究的行为；即“盗尸/掘墓盗尸”。

examples.en: Resurrectionism became common when medical schools needed more bodies for anatomy lessons.
examples.zh: 当医学院需要更多遗体用于解剖课时，盗尸行为（resurrectionism）就变得更常见。

examples.en: The novel mentions resurrectionism to show how dangerous and desperate city life could be.
examples.zh: 小说提到盗尸行为，是为了表现城市生活的危险与绝望。

examples.en: In the film, the police investigate a gang accused of resurrectionism.
examples.zh: 在电影里，警方调查一个被指控盗尸的团伙。

extraExplanation: “Resurrectionism”来自“resurrection（复活）+ -ism（主义/行为）”。这里的“复活”带有讽刺意味：盗尸者把尸体从坟墓里“带回地面”，并非宗教意义上的复活。
这一现象与当时医学发展有关：解剖教学需求上升，但合法遗体来源极少，导致“body snatchers（盗尸者）”形成黑市。英国的《1832年解剖法案》（Anatomy Act 1832）常被认为是为减少此类犯罪而推动的改革之一。
常见相关词：body-snatching（盗尸）、grave robbing（掘墓盗窃）、resurrectionist（盗尸者）。在文学与影视中，它常用来营造哥特/悬疑氛围，或反映社会贫困与法律漏洞。

summary.en: A resurrectionist is historically a body-snatcher who stole corpses for medical dissection; it can also mean someone who revives something from the past.
summary.zh: resurrectionist 历史上指盗掘尸体并卖给医学院解剖的人；也可引申为让旧事物重新流行的“复兴者”。

definition.en: A person who secretly dug up dead bodies (especially in the 1700s–1800s) to sell them for medical study.
definition.zh: （尤指18–19世纪）偷偷盗掘尸体并出售给医学院作解剖研究的人。

examples.en: In 19th-century Britain, some resurrectionists supplied bodies to anatomy schools.
examples.zh: 在19世纪的英国，一些盗尸者把尸体提供给解剖学校。

examples.en: The novel describes a resurrectionist working at night in the graveyard.
examples.zh: 小说描写了一名盗尸者在夜晚的墓地里干活。

definition.en: (By extension) Someone who brings back old ideas, styles, or traditions after they have been forgotten.
definition.zh: （引申）使被遗忘的观念、风格或传统“复活”、重新流行的人。

examples.en: He became a resurrectionist of classical jazz, helping a new generation discover it.
examples.zh: 他成了古典爵士的“复兴者”，让新一代重新认识它。

examples.en: The director is a resurrectionist, reviving old myths in modern films.
examples.zh: 这位导演像“复活者”，把古老神话在现代电影中重新唤起。

extraExplanation: “resurrectionist”来自“resurrection（复活）+ -ist（从事者）”。之所以用“复活”来命名，是因为盗尸者把已下葬的人“挖出来”，好像让尸体“再出现”。
该词常见于英美历史语境（尤其是解剖学发展时期）。由于当时合法尸体来源不足，盗尸和“尸体买卖”一度成为社会问题，并推动了相关法律改革（如19世纪英国的解剖法）。
文学与影视中常带有哥特式/恐怖氛围；需要注意它与“resurrection（宗教意义的复活）”不同，前者多指非法盗掘尸体的人。

summary.en: “Resurrectionize” means to revive or bring something (or someone in fiction) back, often in an informal or playful way.
summary.zh: “resurrectionize”指让某事物复活/复兴，或在虚构作品中让某人起死回生，常带非正式或调侃语气。

definition.en: to bring something back to life, use, or popularity; to revive or restore
definition.zh: 使（某事物）复活；使恢复使用或再度流行；复兴、重振

examples.en: The director tried to resurrectionize the old film series with a modern reboot.
examples.zh: 导演试图用现代重启版让这部老电影系列“复活”。

examples.en: After years of neglect, the community worked to resurrectionize the historic theater.
examples.zh: 荒废多年后，社区努力让这座历史剧院重新焕发生机。

definition.en: (informal, humorous) to bring someone back from death in a story or game
definition.zh: （非正式/带幽默）在故事或游戏中让某人起死回生

examples.en: In the sequel, the writer resurrectionized the villain for one last confrontation.
examples.zh: 在续集中，作者让反派起死回生，进行最后的对决。

examples.en: This spell can resurrectionize a fallen teammate.
examples.zh: 这个法术可以让倒下的队友复活。

extraExplanation: “resurrectionize”不是最常见的标准用词，更常见的是“resurrect”（复活/使复兴）或“revive”（使恢复/使复苏）。它属于把名词“resurrection（复活）”加上动词后缀“-ize”构成的新造词/口语化表达，常见于调侃、媒体评论、流行文化（电影续集、游戏设定）等语境。
语感上它往往比“resurrect”更夸张、更有戏剧性，带一点“硬把它拉回来”的味道。

summary.en: “Resurrections” means multiple returns to life (often religious) or, figuratively, multiple revivals/comebacks of something.
summary.zh: “resurrections”指多次“复活”（常见于宗教语境），也可比喻多次“复兴/回归/重获新生”。

definition.en: The act(s) of bringing someone back to life; returns to life after death (often in religious contexts).
definition.zh: （常用于宗教语境）使人复活的行为；死后再生、复活。

examples.en: In Christianity, the Resurrection of Jesus is a central belief; “resurrections” refers to such events in general.
examples.zh: 在基督教中，耶稣的复活是核心信仰；“resurrections”可泛指这类复活事件。

examples.en: Many myths include stories of resurrections after a hero dies.
examples.zh: 许多神话都包含英雄死后复活的故事。

definition.en: Figurative: the return, revival, or renewed popularity of something that seemed finished or forgotten.
definition.zh: （比喻）复兴、再度兴起；看似结束或被遗忘之事的重现。

examples.en: We’ve seen several resurrections of old fashion trends in recent years.
examples.zh: 近几年我们看到不少旧时尚潮流的“复活”与回潮。

examples.en: After a long break, the band’s resurrections surprised their fans.
examples.zh: 沉寂许久后，这支乐队的多次“复出”让粉丝很惊喜。

examples.en: The city planned a resurrection of the historic theater.
examples.zh: 这座城市计划让那座历史剧院重获新生。

extraExplanation: “resurrection”单数常特指基督教中的“耶稣复活”（The Resurrection）。写作时大写常用于该专指；复数“resurrections”更常用于泛指多次或多种“复活/复兴”。
比喻义在新闻与评论中很常见，常搭配 revival, comeback, rebirth 等词，语气从中性到带一点戏剧性都可能。

summary.en: “Resurrective” means “bringing back to life or reviving something,” but it’s a relatively rare adjective in modern English.
summary.zh: “resurrective”意为“使复活/使复兴、让某事重新恢复”的形容词，但在现代英语中较少见。

definition.en: Able to bring something back to life, use, or attention; relating to resurrection or revival.
definition.zh: 能使某事物“复活”、恢复使用或重新引起关注的；与复活/复兴有关的。

examples.en: The new evidence had a resurrective effect on the cold case.
examples.zh: 新证据对这起悬案起到了“重启/复活”般的作用。

examples.en: After years of silence, a resurrective interest in her music appeared online.
examples.zh: 沉寂多年后，网络上又出现了对她音乐的“复兴式”关注。

extraExplanation: “resurrective”在现代英语里相对少见，更常见的表达是“reviving / restorative / resurgent / resurrection-related”。如果写作想更自然，通常用“revival”相关词替换会更地道。
词根来自“resurrect（使复活/使恢复）+ -ive（形容词后缀）”。语境既可用于宗教意义的“复活”，也常用于比喻：让项目、风格、话题、案件等“重新活起来”。

summary.en: Resurrector means either (1) a reviver who brings something back, or (2) historically, a grave robber who stole bodies.
summary.zh: resurrector 指（1）使某事物“复活/复兴”的人或事物；（2）历史上指盗挖尸体的掘墓盗尸者。

definition.en: A person or thing that brings someone or something back to life, back into use, or back to importance; a reviver.
definition.zh: 使（某人/某物）“复活”、恢复使用或重新变得重要的人或事物；复兴者。

examples.en: Historians sometimes call him the resurrector of interest in the ancient language.
examples.zh: 历史学家有时称他为让人们重新对这门古老语言感兴趣的“复兴者”。

examples.en: This director became a resurrector of forgotten stories by adapting them for modern audiences.
examples.zh: 这位导演通过改编，让被遗忘的故事重新被现代观众看见，成了它们的“复兴者”。

definition.en: A person who digs up dead bodies, historically to steal them (especially for medical study); a “body snatcher.”
definition.zh: （历史用法）挖掘尸体并偷走的人，尤指为医学研究而盗尸者；掘墓盗尸者。

examples.en: In the 1800s, some medical schools depended on resurrectors to supply bodies for anatomy lessons.
examples.zh: 在19世纪，一些医学院曾依赖“盗尸者”为解剖课提供尸体。

examples.en: The novel’s graveyard scenes hint at fear of resurrectors in that era.
examples.zh: 小说中的墓地场景暗示了当时人们对盗尸者的恐惧。

extraExplanation: 这个词来自拉丁语词根 *resurgere*（再次起来）相关的 *resurrect*（使复活/复兴）加上表示“做某事的人”的后缀 *-or*，意思是“使……复活/复兴的人”。
第二个“盗尸者”的含义带有明显的历史背景：18—19世纪英美解剖学发展迅速，但合法遗体来源不足，于是出现了非法挖掘新坟盗取遗体的“resurrectionists / resurrectors”。现代英语中更常见的说法是 *body snatcher* 或 *resurrectionist*。

summary.en: Resurrectors are people who bring someone/something back (literally or figuratively). In historical contexts, it can also mean grave robbers who stole bodies for anatomy.
summary.zh: resurrectors 指让人或事物“复活/复兴/重新运作”的人；在历史语境中也可指为解剖研究而盗挖尸体的盗尸者。

definition.en: People who bring someone or something back to life, consciousness, or active use; people who revive what seemed finished or forgotten.
definition.zh: 复活者；使（人或事物）“重获生命/恢复意识/重新启用”的人；让看似结束或被遗忘的事物重新活跃的人。

examples.en: In the story, the resurrectors return the hero from the dead.
examples.zh: 在故事里，复活者让英雄起死回生。

examples.en: These volunteers were the resurrectors of the old neighborhood library—they reopened it and filled it with books.
examples.zh: 这些志愿者是老社区图书馆的“复兴者”——他们重新开放图书馆，并把书补齐了。

definition.en: (Historical, less common) People who secretly dug up dead bodies—especially in 18th–19th century Britain—for medical study; also called “resurrectionists.”
definition.zh: （历史用法，较少见）盗挖尸体者（尤指18—19世纪英国为医学研究而偷挖尸体的人）；也叫“resurrectionists”。

examples.en: The novel mentions resurrectors who sold bodies to anatomy schools.
examples.zh: 小说提到一些盗挖尸体者，把尸体卖给解剖学校。

extraExplanation: “resurrector(s)”来自动词 resurrect（使复活、使复兴）+ 表示“做某事的人”的后缀 -or。
历史上英国出现过“resurrectionists”（盗尸者），因为当时合法尸体来源不足，一些人就偷挖坟墓把尸体卖给医学院做解剖研究；文学与影视里偶尔会用来营造哥特/惊悚氛围。

summary.en: “Resurrects” means brings someone back to life, or brings something back into use or attention.
summary.zh: “resurrects”表示使（人）复活，或使（事物）重新恢复使用/重新引起关注。

definition.en: to bring (someone) back to life; to revive after death
definition.zh: 使（某人）复活；使死而复生

examples.en: In the story, the hero resurrects after three days.
examples.zh: 在故事里，英雄三天后复活。

examples.en: Some religions believe God resurrects the dead at the end of time.
examples.zh: 一些宗教相信上帝会在末日使死者复活。

definition.en: to bring something back into use, attention, or memory; to revive or restore
definition.zh: 使（事物）重新出现/恢复使用；重振；重新唤起（记忆、关注）

examples.en: The new movie resurrects interest in the old book series.
examples.zh: 这部新电影重新唤起了人们对那套老书的兴趣。

examples.en: The company resurrects a classic design from the 1990s.
examples.zh: 公司重新推出了一个90年代的经典设计。

extraExplanation: “resurrect”常见于宗教与文学语境，尤其与基督教中的“复活（the Resurrection）”有关，因此语气往往较庄重。日常口语里谈“让某个想法/项目重获生机”也可以用，但比“revive”更有“死而复生、重新出现”的强烈画面感。

summary.en: “Resurrender” means to surrender again—to give up control, rights, or a position a second time.
summary.zh: “resurrender”指“再次投降/再次交出”，强调第二次放弃控制、权利或阵地。

definition.en: to surrender again; to give up control, a position, or rights after having regained them or after a previous surrender
definition.zh: 再次投降；在曾经投降或重新取得后，再次放弃控制、阵地或权利

examples.en: After briefly retaking the town, the troops were forced to resurrender two days later.
examples.zh: 部队短暂夺回小镇后，两天后被迫再次投降。

examples.en: The company had to resurrender the license when new regulations took effect.
examples.zh: 新法规生效后，这家公司不得不再次交回许可证。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再一次/重新”，所以 resurrender 直观含义就是“再次 surrender”。该词在日常口语中不算常见，更常见的表达是 “surrender again” 或 “surrender once more”。
在军事、政治或法律语境中更可能出现，用来强调“已经投降/交出过一次，但又发生变化后再次投降/交出”。拼写上通常写作 resurrender（也有人写 re-surrender）。

summary.en: “Resurround” means to surround something again.
summary.zh: “resurround”表示“再次包围、重新围住”。

definition.en: to surround again; to form a new ring or boundary around something after it has changed or been removed
definition.zh: 再次包围；重新在某物周围形成一圈（边界、环绕物等）

examples.en: After the fence was repaired, the workers resurrounded the garden with fresh wire.
examples.zh: 栅栏修好后，工人用新的铁丝把花园重新围了起来。

examples.en: Snow slowly resurrounded the cabin, covering the path they had cleared.
examples.zh: 雪慢慢又把小木屋围住，盖住了他们清理出来的小路。

extraExplanation: “resurround”相对少见，更常见的表达是 “surround again” 或写作 “re-surround”。它多用于描述边界、围栏、群体、雾气/雪等“重新包围”的动作，常见于较正式或描写性的写作。

summary.en: Resurvey means to survey again, or the second survey itself.
summary.zh: resurvey 指“再次测量/调查”，也可指“复测/复查”这一第二次调查本身。

definition.en: to survey again; to examine, measure, or study something a second time (often to correct, update, or confirm earlier results)
definition.zh: 再次测量/勘测/调查；对某事进行第二次检查、测定或研究（常为纠正、更新或核实先前结果）

examples.en: After the storm, the engineers resurveyed the bridge to check for damage.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，工程师再次勘测这座桥，以检查是否受损。

examples.en: The company will resurvey customers next month to see if opinions have changed.
examples.zh: 公司下个月将再次调查顾客，看看意见是否有变化。

definition.en: a second survey; a repeat measurement or investigation
definition.zh: 复测；复查；再次调查（指第二次的测量或调查行为/结果）

examples.en: A resurvey of the property revealed that the fence was on the wrong side of the boundary.
examples.zh: 对该房产的复测发现，栅栏在边界的错误一侧。

extraExplanation: “resurvey”常见于两个语境：①土地/工程测量（boundary lines, property lines 等），强调“复测”以纠错或更新数据；②市场或社会调查（customer survey 等），强调“再次调查”以比较变化。
构词法：re-（再次）+ survey（测量/调查）。更口语时也可说 “survey again”，但在正式报告、工程文件里更常用 “resurvey”。

summary.en: “Resurveyed” means “surveyed again” to recheck or update measurements or boundaries.
summary.zh: “Resurveyed”表示“重新勘测/复测”，用于复核或更新测量数据与边界。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of resurvey) to survey or measure an area again, often to check accuracy, update boundaries, or reflect changes.
definition.zh: （resurvey 的过去式/过去分词）对某片区域再次测量或勘测，常用于核对精度、更新边界或反映变化。

examples.en: After the flood, engineers resurveyed the riverbank to update the maps.
examples.zh: 洪水过后，工程师重新勘测了河岸，以更新地图。

examples.en: The land was resurveyed to confirm the property boundary.
examples.zh: 这块土地被重新测量，以确认产权边界。

extraExplanation: “resurvey”常见于土地测量（land surveying）、地图绘制（mapping）、工程与建筑（engineering/construction）等语境。前缀 re- 表示“再次、重新”。
在房地产或法律文件里，重新勘测可能会影响“boundary line（边界线）”“property line（地界）”等表述，语境通常较正式。

summary.en: “Resurveying” means surveying again—especially re-measuring land to confirm or correct boundaries or maps.
summary.zh: “Resurveying”指重新勘测/复测，尤其是对土地边界或地图数据再次测量以确认或纠正。

definition.en: surveying again; measuring and mapping land (or checking survey results) a second time, often to confirm boundaries or correct earlier errors.
definition.zh: 重新测量/重新勘测；对土地（或测量结果）再次测绘与核对，常用于确认边界或纠正先前误差。

examples.en: The engineers are resurveying the property line to settle the boundary dispute.
examples.zh: 工程师正在重新勘测地界，以解决边界纠纷。

examples.en: After the storm, the team began resurveying the coastline to update the maps.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，团队开始重新测量海岸线，以更新地图。

definition.en: reviewing or examining something again in a broad sense (less common in everyday use).
definition.zh: （较不常见）再次审视/复查某事（更宽泛的用法）。

examples.en: She spent the weekend resurveying her notes before the final exam.
examples.zh: 她周末重新复习了笔记，准备期末考试。

extraExplanation: “resurveying”是动词“resurvey”的现在分词/动名词形式：re-（再一次）+ survey（测量、勘测、调查）。在房地产、工程、土地管理语境中最常见，通常指“复测边界/复核测量数据”。
日常英语里表示“重新查看”的意思时，常用更自然的动词如 review、recheck、revisit；用 resurvey 会显得偏正式或偏技术。

summary.en: “Resurveys” is the plural noun or third-person singular verb form of “resurvey,” meaning to survey again or repeated surveys done again.
summary.zh: “resurveys”是“resurvey”的第三人称单数动词或复数名词形式，表示“再次勘测/调查”，或指“复测/复查性调查”。

definition.en: to survey (measure, map, or examine) again, usually to update boundaries, correct errors, or check changes over time
definition.zh: 再次测量/勘测（重新丈量、制图或检查），通常用于更新边界、纠正误差或核查随时间的变化

examples.en: The county resurveys the road every few years to update its official map.
examples.zh: 该县每隔几年会重新勘测这条道路，以更新官方地图。

examples.en: After the flood, engineers resurveyed the riverbanks to record the new shape of the land.
examples.zh: 洪水过后，工程师重新勘测河岸，以记录地形的新变化。

definition.en: repeated surveys; second or later rounds of surveying or checking
definition.zh: 复测；复查性调查（第二次或多次进行的测量/调查）

examples.en: The resurveys showed that the property line was slightly different from the old records.
examples.zh: 复测结果显示，地界与旧档案记载略有不同。

extraExplanation: “resurvey”由前缀 re-（再次）+ survey（测量/调查）构成。常见于土地边界测量、地图更新、工程复核，也可用于社会科学里“再次调查/复访”同一群体或同一问题。

summary.en: Resuscitable means “able or likely to be brought back by medical resuscitation (like CPR).”
summary.zh: resuscitable 指“有可能通过医疗复苏（如心肺复苏）救回来的；可复苏的”。

definition.en: Able to be brought back to life or consciousness by medical help (for example, CPR).
definition.zh: （通过医疗手段如心肺复苏）可以被救活的；可复苏的。

examples.en: The doctor said the patient was still resuscitable if CPR started immediately.
examples.zh: 医生说如果立刻开始心肺复苏，病人仍然有救活的可能。

examples.en: In some emergencies, seconds matter because a person may be resuscitable for only a short time.
examples.zh: 在某些紧急情况下，时间以秒计算，因为一个人可复苏的时间可能很短。

definition.en: (Medical) Likely to respond to resuscitation efforts; having a condition or rhythm that can be treated successfully.
definition.zh: （医学）对复苏措施可能有反应的；（如某些心律）有机会通过复苏成功纠正的。

examples.en: The team checked quickly for a resuscitable rhythm before continuing treatment.
examples.zh: 医疗团队在继续治疗前迅速检查是否存在可复苏的心律。

examples.en: They focused on patients with resuscitable signs because resources were limited.
examples.zh: 由于资源有限，他们优先处理仍有可复苏迹象的患者。

extraExplanation: “resuscitable”常见于急救与重症医学语境，强调“仍有机会通过及时干预恢复循环/呼吸或意识”。在日常英语里更常用“can be resuscitated / revivable / salvageable（在某些语境）”。
词形来源：resuscitate（使复苏）+ -able（能够……的）。在医疗记录或研究文章中比口语更常见。

summary.en: Resuscitant means “reviving” (adj.) or “a reviving agent/drug” (n.), mainly used in medical or formal writing.
summary.zh: resuscitant 指“能使人复苏的”（形容词）或“复苏剂/复苏药”（名词），主要见于医学或较正式的写作。

definition.en: able to revive someone; bringing someone back to life or consciousness (often in a medical context).
definition.zh: 能使人复苏的；使人从昏迷或濒死状态恢复意识/生命体征的（常用于医学语境）。

examples.en: The doctor used resuscitant measures to restore the patient’s breathing.
examples.zh: 医生采取了复苏措施，使病人恢复呼吸。

examples.en: In the report, the drug was described as resuscitant after cardiac arrest.
examples.zh: 报告中称这种药物对心搏骤停后的复苏有作用。

definition.en: a medicine or substance that revives someone or restores vital functions.
definition.zh: 复苏剂；用于使人恢复生命体征的药物或物质。

examples.en: Oxygen can act as a resuscitant in emergency care.
examples.zh: 在急救中，氧气可以作为复苏剂发挥作用。

examples.en: The kit included a resuscitant and basic first-aid supplies.
examples.zh: 急救包里有复苏用药品和基础急救用品。

extraExplanation: 这个词在日常英语里比较少见，更常见的表达是 resuscitation（复苏）、resuscitate（使复苏）以及 resuscitative（复苏的）。在医疗写作或较正式的语境中才更可能看到 resuscitant。
词源上与拉丁语 suscitare（唤起、使苏醒）有关，前缀 re- 表示“再次”。

summary.en: Resuscitate means to bring someone back to life or consciousness (often with medical help), or to revive something that has become inactive.
summary.zh: resuscitate 指（常借助医疗手段）使人苏醒/复苏，也可指使某事物恢复活力、重振。

definition.en: to bring someone back to consciousness or life, especially by giving emergency medical help (for example, CPR)
definition.zh: （尤指通过急救，如心肺复苏）使（某人）苏醒；使起死回生

examples.en: The lifeguard resuscitated the swimmer with CPR.
examples.zh: 救生员用心肺复苏抢救了那名游泳者。

examples.en: Paramedics tried to resuscitate him on the way to the hospital.
examples.zh: 护理人员在送医途中试图对他进行抢救复苏。

definition.en: to make something active, successful, or popular again; to revive
definition.zh: 使（事物）复兴；使恢复活力；重振

examples.en: The new coach resuscitated the team’s confidence.
examples.zh: 新教练重振了球队的信心。

examples.en: They hope to resuscitate the old neighborhood festival.
examples.zh: 他们希望让老街区的节日活动重新兴盛起来。

extraExplanation: “resuscitate”常见于医疗语境，和“revive”很接近，但更正式、更偏“抢救/复苏”的感觉；日常口语里说人醒过来常用“revive”或“come to”。
词源来自拉丁语，字面含义是“再次唤醒/再次使活起来”；因此也可引申为“让计划、传统、关系等重新活跃”。
常见搭配：resuscitate a patient（抢救病人）、resuscitate someone with CPR（用心肺复苏抢救）、resuscitate an economy/industry/tradition（振兴经济/行业/传统）。

summary.en: Resuscitated means brought back to life or consciousness, or revived in activity/attention.
summary.zh: Resuscitated 指“被抢救苏醒/复活”，也可比喻“被重新启动、复兴”。

definition.en: brought back to life or consciousness after being unconscious or seemingly dead (often using CPR or medical treatment).
definition.zh: （常指用心肺复苏或医疗手段）使苏醒、使复活；把看似死亡或失去意识的人救回。

examples.en: The paramedics resuscitated the man after his heart stopped.
examples.zh: 医护人员在他心脏骤停后把他抢救了回来。

examples.en: She was resuscitated and taken to the hospital for further care.
examples.zh: 她被救醒后送往医院接受进一步治疗。

definition.en: brought back into use, activity, or attention; revived.
definition.zh: （计划、传统、话题等）重新启动；使复兴、再度活跃。

examples.en: The city resuscitated the old festival to attract visitors.
examples.zh: 这座城市重启了旧的节日来吸引游客。

examples.en: The report resuscitated a debate people thought was over.
examples.zh: 这份报告让人们以为已经结束的争论又重新出现了。

extraExplanation: “resuscitated”是动词resuscitate的过去式/过去分词，也常当形容词用来描述“被救活/被复苏”的状态。
医学语境中更常见搭配：resuscitate a patient（复苏病人）、cardiac resuscitation（心脏复苏）、resuscitation attempts（复苏尝试）。日常或比喻语境中常与idea、project、tradition、debate等搭配，表示“让……死灰复燃/重新活起来”。

summary.en: “Resuscitates” means brings someone back to life/consciousness or revives something that had stopped or faded.
summary.zh: “resuscitates”表示（抢救）使人苏醒/复活，或使某事物重新恢复、复兴。

definition.en: brings someone back to life or consciousness, especially by medical help (for example, CPR)
definition.zh: （尤指通过医疗手段，如心肺复苏CPR）使某人苏醒/复活

examples.en: The paramedic resuscitates the patient with CPR.
examples.zh: 急救员用心肺复苏让病人苏醒。

examples.en: Quick action sometimes resuscitates a drowning victim.
examples.zh: 迅速的行动有时能让溺水者被抢救回来。

definition.en: brings something back into use, popularity, or activity; revives
definition.zh: 使（事物）重新流行/恢复使用/重新活跃；复兴

examples.en: The new coach resuscitates the team’s confidence.
examples.zh: 新教练让球队的信心重新振作起来。

examples.en: The film resuscitates interest in an old legend.
examples.zh: 这部电影让人们重新对一个古老传说产生兴趣。

extraExplanation: “resuscitates”是动词 resuscitate 的第三人称单数现在时：He/She/It resuscitates…；过去式/过去分词是 resuscitated。
词源来自拉丁语前缀 re-（再、重新）+ suscitare（唤起、使苏醒），所以核心感觉是“让某物/某人重新醒来”。在医学语境中更偏正式，日常口语里常用 revive。

summary.en: Resuscitating means trying to bring someone back to life or consciousness, or (figuratively) bringing something back into active use.
summary.zh: resuscitating 指抢救使人复苏；也可比喻使某事物恢复活力、重新兴起。

definition.en: bringing someone back to consciousness or life, especially by giving emergency medical help (like CPR)
definition.zh: （尤指通过急救措施如心肺复苏等）使人苏醒或复生；抢救

examples.en: The paramedics kept resuscitating the patient until a pulse returned.
examples.zh: 急救人员一直在抢救病人，直到脉搏恢复。

examples.en: She learned CPR so she could help in case someone needed resuscitating.
examples.zh: 她学习了心肺复苏，以便在有人需要抢救时能帮上忙。

definition.en: bringing something back into use, strength, or activity (a plan, tradition, economy, etc.)
definition.zh: （比喻）使（计划、传统、组织、经济等）复兴；重新恢复活力

examples.en: They are resuscitating an old neighborhood festival.
examples.zh: 他们正在让一个老社区节日重新办起来。

examples.en: New funding is resuscitating the project after years of delays.
examples.zh: 新的资金让这个因多年拖延的项目重新启动。

extraExplanation: “resuscitating”是动词resuscitate的现在分词/动名词形式，常见于进行时（are resuscitating）或作后置修饰（a resuscitating team）。
医学语境里常与CPR（cardiopulmonary resuscitation，心肺复苏）一起出现；日常比喻义则表示“让某事恢复生机/重新流行”。
词源来自拉丁语“resuscitare”，含义是“再次唤醒/使再度活过来”，因此既可指生理上的“复苏”，也可指事物的“复兴”。

summary.en: Resuscitation means bringing someone back to life or consciousness (often with CPR), or reviving something that has become weak or inactive.
summary.zh: resuscitation 指“（医学上的）复苏/抢救（常用CPR）”，也可指“（事物的）复兴/重振”。

definition.en: The act of bringing someone back to consciousness or back to life, especially by giving emergency medical help (for example, CPR).
definition.zh: 复苏；抢救（尤指通过紧急医疗措施，如心肺复苏CPR，使人恢复意识或生命体征）。

examples.en: The nurse began resuscitation immediately when the patient stopped breathing.
examples.zh: 病人停止呼吸后，护士立刻开始抢救。

examples.en: Bystanders performed CPR until the ambulance arrived, and the resuscitation was successful.
examples.zh: 路人一直做心肺复苏直到救护车到达，最终抢救成功。

definition.en: The act of making something active, strong, or popular again after it has declined.
definition.zh: （事物的）复兴；振兴；重振（指衰落后再次变得活跃、有力或受欢迎）。

examples.en: The city invested in public art as part of the resuscitation of its downtown area.
examples.zh: 这座城市投资公共艺术，作为振兴市中心的一部分。

examples.en: There has been a resuscitation of interest in vinyl records in recent years.
examples.zh: 近年来，人们对黑胶唱片的兴趣重新兴起。

extraExplanation: 在医学语境中，resuscitation 常与 CPR（cardiopulmonary resuscitation，心肺复苏）和 AED（automated external defibrillator，自动体外除颤器）一起出现。常见搭配：attempt resuscitation（尝试抢救）、successful/failed resuscitation（抢救成功/失败）。
词源上来自拉丁语前缀 re-（再次）+ suscitare（唤醒、使苏醒），所以既可指“抢救复苏”，也可引申为“让某事恢复活力/重新兴起”。

summary.en: “Resuscitations” means repeated attempts to revive someone (medical), or figuratively, attempts to revive something that has faded.
summary.zh: “resuscitations”指（医疗上的）多次复苏/抢救尝试，也可比喻为让沉寂事物重新复兴的努力。

definition.en: Attempts or actions to bring someone back to life or restore breathing/heartbeat, especially in a medical emergency (e.g., CPR).
definition.zh: （尤指在紧急医疗情况下）复苏/抢救的行为或尝试，使人恢复呼吸或心跳（如心肺复苏 CPR）。

examples.en: The paramedics performed two resuscitations before the patient regained a pulse.
examples.zh: 急救人员进行了两次复苏抢救后，病人恢复了脉搏。

examples.en: The hospital trains staff to respond quickly during resuscitations.
examples.zh: 医院培训员工在抢救复苏时迅速应对。

definition.en: Figurative: efforts to bring something back after it has been inactive or forgotten (e.g., a tradition, project, or debate).
definition.zh: （比喻）让某事物在沉寂或被遗忘后“复兴/重启”的努力（如传统、项目或讨论）。

examples.en: The documentary led to resuscitations of interest in the old neighborhood’s history.
examples.zh: 这部纪录片让人们对老街区历史的兴趣重新复燃。

examples.en: Funding cuts prevented any resuscitations of the stalled research project.
examples.zh: 经费削减使停滞的研究项目无法重启。

extraExplanation: “resuscitation”常见于医疗语境，最常见的相关表达是 CPR（cardiopulmonary resuscitation，心肺复苏）。在医院里也会出现“resuscitation room”（抢救室）或“resuscitation team”（抢救团队）。
在英语新闻或医疗剧中，resuscitation 往往与“DNR”（Do Not Resuscitate，不施行复苏）一起出现，指病人的预先医疗决定。

summary.en: Resuscitative means related to emergency actions that restore breathing and heartbeat, such as CPR.
summary.zh: resuscitative 指与紧急复苏抢救有关（如心肺复苏）的。

definition.en: Related to bringing someone back to life or restoring normal breathing and heartbeat, especially in an emergency (for example, CPR).
definition.zh: 与复苏有关的；指在紧急情况下使人恢复呼吸和心跳、进行抢救（如心肺复苏）的。

examples.en: The paramedic began resuscitative efforts immediately.
examples.zh: 急救员立刻开始进行复苏抢救。

examples.en: The hospital has a special room for resuscitative care.
examples.zh: 医院有专门用于复苏救治的房间。

extraExplanation: “resuscitative”常见于医疗/急救语境，搭配很固定，比如 resuscitative efforts（复苏抢救措施）、resuscitative care（复苏救治）、resuscitative measures（复苏措施）。日常口语里更常说 CPR 或 life-saving measures（救命措施）。
词源上与拉丁语“resuscitare（使…复苏）”相关；相关词包括 resuscitate（动词：使复苏）和 resuscitation（名词：复苏、复苏术）。

summary.en: A resuscitator is usually a medical device used to help someone breathe during an emergency; less commonly, it can mean a person who performs resuscitation.
summary.zh: resuscitator通常指急救中帮助患者呼吸的医疗设备；较少情况下也可指实施复苏急救的人。

definition.en: A device (often a bag-valve mask or similar equipment) used to help a person breathe by pushing air/oxygen into the lungs, especially in emergencies.
definition.zh: 复苏器；人工呼吸器（常指简易呼吸器等设备，用于在紧急情况下向肺部送入空气/氧气，帮助患者呼吸）。

examples.en: The paramedic used a resuscitator to ventilate the patient until they reached the hospital.
examples.zh: 急救医护人员用复苏器为患者进行通气，直到抵达医院。

examples.en: Make sure the resuscitator is connected to an oxygen supply if available.
examples.zh: 如果条件允许，确保复苏器连接到氧气供给。

definition.en: A person who revives someone, especially by giving emergency medical help such as CPR.
definition.zh: 施行复苏的人；急救复苏者（指通过心肺复苏等急救手段使人苏醒的人）。

examples.en: In the report, the resuscitator noted the exact time CPR began.
examples.zh: 在报告中，施行复苏的人记录了开始心肺复苏的准确时间。

examples.en: A trained resuscitator can make a critical difference in the first few minutes.
examples.zh: 受过训练的复苏者在最初几分钟可能起到决定性作用。

extraExplanation: “Resuscitator”在日常英语中更常指“设备”（尤其在医疗/急救语境），而指“人”时相对少见。很多场合会用更常见的说法：指设备可说“bag-valve mask (BVM)”或“manual resuscitator”，指人可说“rescuer”或“CPR provider”。

summary.en: Resuscitators are either people who revive someone (e.g., via CPR) or devices that help restore breathing (e.g., a bag-valve mask).
summary.zh: resuscitators 指“施救/复苏的人”（如做心肺复苏的人）或“复苏装置”（如球囊面罩 BVM）。

definition.en: People who bring someone back to consciousness or restore breathing/heartbeat (for example, by CPR).
definition.zh: 使人苏醒或恢复呼吸/心跳的人（例如实施心肺复苏的人）。

examples.en: The resuscitators continued CPR until the ambulance arrived.
examples.zh: 施救人员一直进行心肺复苏，直到救护车到达。

examples.en: In the report, the resuscitators were praised for acting quickly.
examples.zh: 在报告中，施救人员因反应迅速而受到表扬。

definition.en: Devices used to help someone breathe again, especially a manual resuscitator (bag-valve mask).
definition.zh: 帮助患者恢复呼吸的装置，尤其指手动复苏器（球囊面罩，BVM）。

examples.en: The clinic stocked resuscitators in every emergency kit.
examples.zh: 诊所的每个急救包里都配备了复苏器。

examples.en: The nurse grabbed a resuscitator and began ventilating the patient.
examples.zh: 护士拿起复苏器，开始为患者进行通气。

extraExplanation: “resuscitators”是复数形式；单数是“resuscitator”。在新闻或报告里常指“施救者/抢救人员”，在医疗场景中也常指“手动复苏器（BVM/ambu bag）”。具体含义通常要看上下文（是“人”还是“设备”）。

summary.en: “Resuspect” is a rare/nonstandard verb meaning “to suspect again,” but most people say “suspect again.”
summary.zh: “resuspect”是很少见/不太标准的动词，意思是“再次怀疑”，更常用说法是“suspect again”。

definition.en: (Rare / nonstandard) to suspect again; to become suspicious of someone or something once more.
definition.zh: （罕见/非标准用法）再次怀疑；重新对某人或某事起疑心。

examples.en: After hearing the new evidence, the detective resuspected the original witness.
examples.zh: 听到新的证据后，侦探又开始怀疑最初的证人。

examples.en: She had trusted him, but his sudden silence made her resuspect his motives.
examples.zh: 她原本信任他，但他突然沉默让她又开始怀疑他的动机。

extraExplanation: “resuspect”在现代英语里几乎不用，很多词典不会收录。日常表达更常用：suspect again / become suspicious again / suspect him again。
它也很可能是拼写或输入错误：最常见的目标词是“respect”（尊重）或“suspect”（怀疑）。如果你告诉我你想表达的中文意思或句子语境，我可以帮你确认正确单词。

summary.en: Resuspend means to mix something that has settled back into a liquid so it becomes evenly suspended again.
summary.zh: resuspend 指把已经沉淀/分层的物质重新混回液体中，使其再次均匀悬浮。

definition.en: To mix a substance that has settled to the bottom back into the liquid so it is evenly spread again.
definition.zh: （使沉淀的物质）重新悬浮；把沉在底部的东西重新混匀到液体中。

examples.en: Gently resuspend the cells by pipetting up and down.
examples.zh: 用移液器轻轻上下吸打，使细胞重新悬浮。

examples.en: The powder settles quickly, so shake the bottle to resuspend it before use.
examples.zh: 粉末沉得很快，所以使用前要摇匀让它重新悬浮。

definition.en: To become mixed back into a liquid after having settled.
definition.zh: （沉淀物）重新悬浮；再次混入液体中。

examples.en: If you stir slowly, the sediment will resuspend in the water.
examples.zh: 如果你慢慢搅拌，沉淀物会重新在水中悬浮。

extraExplanation: 该词多见于科学/实验语境（生物、化学、制药）。常与 cells（细胞）、pellet（沉淀团/沉淀物）、sediment（沉积物）、buffer（缓冲液）、solution（溶液）搭配。
与 suspend（使悬浮）相比，resuspend 强调“原本沉下去了/分层了，现在再让它回到悬浮状态”，常见操作包括轻轻吹打（pipette）、轻摇（invert/shake）、涡旋振荡（vortex）。
发音中 re- 常读作 /ri-/，整体重音通常在 -SUSPEND 上。

summary.en: Resuspension is the process of making settled particles mix again, especially in science and lab contexts.
summary.zh: Resuspension 指让已沉降的颗粒重新被搅起并再次混合的过程，常见于环境科学与实验室语境。

definition.en: the act or process of making particles that have settled (in a liquid, gas, or on a surface) move and mix again
definition.zh: （使沉降的颗粒在液体、气体或表面）重新被搅起并再次混合的过程；再悬浮

examples.en: Shake the bottle gently to ensure complete resuspension of the powder.
examples.zh: 轻轻摇匀瓶子，确保粉末充分再悬浮。

examples.en: Wind can cause resuspension of dust from dry soil.
examples.zh: 风会使干燥土壤中的尘土再次扬起。

examples.en: The lab measured resuspension of sediment after the boat passed.
examples.zh: 实验室测量了船只经过后沉积物的再悬浮情况。

definition.en: in medicine or administration, the act of starting something again after it was paused or stopped (less common)
definition.zh: （较少见）在医疗或行政语境中，暂停或中止后重新开始（如重新用药/重新启用）的行为

examples.en: The doctor discussed resuspension of the medication after the side effects improved.
examples.zh: 副作用好转后，医生讨论了是否重新开始用药。

examples.en: Resuspension of the program depends on new funding.
examples.zh: 该项目能否重新启动取决于新的资金。

extraExplanation: 在科学语境里，resuspension 很常见：例如“沉积物再悬浮”（sediment resuspension）、“气溶胶/粉尘再悬浮”（dust resuspension）。它强调“原本沉降/沉积的颗粒被扰动后又回到悬浮状态”，与 suspension（悬浮液/悬浮状态）密切相关。
词形上是 re-（再次）+ suspension（悬浮/暂停）。在环境科学中它常与风、车流、浪、船只等“扰动因素”搭配；在实验室里常用来描述“把沉淀重新摇匀/吹打均匀”。

summary.en: “Reswage” is not standard; it’s likely a typo or an informal/technical way to say “re-wage” (wage again / recalculate wages).
summary.zh: “reswage”不是标准用词；多半是拼写错误，或非正式/技术性写法，想表达“re-wage”（再次进行/重新计薪）。

definition.en: Not a standard English word in general use. It is most likely a typo or a rare/technical form intended to mean “re-wage” (to wage again) or “re-wage/recalculate wages” in a payroll context.
definition.zh: 不是常见的标准英语词。更可能是拼写错误，或在很少见/技术语境中指“re-wage”（再次发动/进行）或在工资结算语境中指“重新计算工资”。

examples.en: I can’t find “reswage” in a standard dictionary—did you mean “rewage” or “wage”?
examples.zh: 我在常见词典里查不到“reswage”——你是想写“rewage”还是“wage”吗？

examples.en: In some payroll notes, “re-wage” may be used informally to mean recalculating an employee’s wages.
examples.zh: 在一些工资结算备注里，“re-wage”可能被非正式地用来表示重新计算员工工资。

extraExplanation: “reswage”几乎不作为标准词条出现。如果你是在表格/系统里看到的，可能是某家公司内部缩写、拼写错误，或把“re-wage（重新计薪）”连写了。
如果你告诉我你看到它的句子或截图（或它出现在哪个行业：工资、合同、游戏、编程等），我可以更准确判断它想表达的词（例如：wage, re-wage, reassuage, sewage 等）。

summary.en: Reswallow means to swallow something again.
summary.zh: Reswallow 意为“再次吞咽、重新咽下”。

definition.en: to swallow something again (for example, after it comes back up or after you hesitated).
definition.zh: 再次吞咽（例如东西反上来后又吞回去，或犹豫后又咽下去）。

examples.en: He coughed, then reswallowed the water and tried to speak again.
examples.zh: 他咳了几声，又把水咽了下去，试着再开口说话。

examples.en: She tasted the medicine, made a face, and reswallowed it quickly.
examples.zh: 她尝到药味皱了皱眉，又赶紧把它咽下去。

extraExplanation: “re-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“再次、重新”。所以 reswallow 字面意思就是“再吞一次”。这个词在日常口语里不算常见，更常见的说法是 “swallow again”。
在比喻用法中，有时也可以指“把想说的话又咽回去”（类似 swallow one’s words），但这种用法更常见的表达是 “swallow it / swallow your words”。

summary.en: Reward means a prize/benefit you receive for doing something good, or the act of giving that prize/benefit.
summary.zh: reward 指因表现良好而得到的“奖励/回报”，也可作动词表示“奖励、奖赏”。

definition.en: Something you receive because you did something good or helpful; a prize, payment, or benefit.
definition.zh: 因做好事或有贡献而得到的回报；奖励、报酬或好处。

examples.en: The reward for winning the contest was $500.
examples.zh: 比赛获胜的奖励是500美元。

examples.en: Helping others can be its own reward.
examples.zh: 帮助别人本身就是一种回报。

definition.en: To give someone something because they did something good, helpful, or brave.
definition.zh: 因某人表现良好、有帮助或勇敢而给予奖励；奖赏。

examples.en: The company rewarded her for her hard work.
examples.zh: 公司因她的努力工作而奖励了她。

examples.en: He was rewarded with a scholarship.
examples.zh: 他获得了奖学金作为奖励。

extraExplanation: “resward”不是常见英语单词，通常是把“reward”拼错了。学习时建议记住：re-（再次/回）+ ward（保护/看护相关），联想到“给回报、奖励”。

summary.en: Reswarm means to swarm again, or to make a group swarm again (often used with bees).
summary.zh: reswarm 指“再次成群聚集”，也可指“使某群体再次成群”（常用于蜜蜂/养蜂语境）。

definition.en: to swarm again; to gather in a large moving group after dispersing
definition.zh: 再次成群聚集；（散开后）又重新大量聚拢

examples.en: After the loud noise, the bees scattered and then reswarmed near the hive entrance.
examples.zh: 巨响过后，蜜蜂四散，随后又在蜂巢入口附近重新聚集。

examples.en: Fans left the stadium, then reswarmed around the subway station.
examples.zh: 球迷离开体育场后，又在地铁站周围重新聚拢。

definition.en: to cause a group (especially insects) to swarm again or to form a new swarm
definition.zh: 使（尤指昆虫）再次成群；促使形成新的蜂群/群体

examples.en: The beekeeper tried to reswarm the bees into a box.
examples.zh: 养蜂人试图把蜜蜂重新聚到一个箱子里。

examples.en: Warm weather can reswarm insects that had been hiding.
examples.zh: 温暖的天气可能会让原本躲藏的昆虫再次成群活动。

extraExplanation: “reswarm”比较少见，更常写作“re-swarm”（加连字符）来强调“再次成群”。在养蜂语境里，它常与蜂群分离、回巢、或形成新群有关；在日常写作中也可比喻人群“又一次聚拢”。

summary.en: “Reswear” means to swear again or repeat an oath, often in formal or legal contexts.
summary.zh: “reswear”意为“再次发誓/重新宣誓”，多用于正式或法律语境。

definition.en: to swear again; to repeat an oath or promise
definition.zh: 再次发誓；重新宣誓（重复誓言或承诺）

examples.en: After the ceremony, the officials had to reswear the oath because of a mistake in the wording.
examples.zh: 仪式结束后，由于措辞出错，官员们不得不重新宣誓。

examples.en: He reswore that he would never lie to his family again.
examples.zh: 他再次发誓再也不会对家人说谎。

extraExplanation: “reswear”由前缀 re-（再次）+ swear（发誓）组成，但在现代日常英语中很少使用；更常见的表达是 “swear again” 或（在正式/法律语境）“retake the oath / reaffirm the oath”。
在法律或宣誓场合，若誓词读错、程序有瑕疵，可能会要求当事人“reswear”来使宣誓有效。

summary.en: “Reswearing” means swearing again—repeating or reaffirming an oath or strong promise.
summary.zh: “reswearing”表示再次宣誓——重复或重新确认誓言/郑重承诺。

definition.en: swearing again; repeating or reaffirming an oath or strong promise
definition.zh: 再次宣誓；重复或重新确认誓言/郑重承诺

examples.en: The witness began reswearing the statement in court.
examples.zh: 证人在法庭上开始重新宣誓确认那份陈述。

examples.en: By reswearing his loyalty, he tried to regain the group’s trust.
examples.zh: 他通过再次宣誓效忠，试图重新获得团队的信任。

extraExplanation: “reswearing”是动词“reswear”的现在分词/动名词形式。“re-”表示“再一次”，加在“swear（宣誓/发誓）”前，意思就是“再发誓”。
这个词在现代英语里比较少见，更常见的表达是“swear again”或在法律语境中用“reaffirm (an oath)”（重新确认誓言/证词）。

summary.en: “Resweat” means to sweat again, and less commonly to heat a material so it releases substances again.
summary.zh: “resweat”指“再次出汗”；较少见时也可指工艺上加热材料使其再次析出物质。

definition.en: to sweat again; to start sweating a second time (often after a short rest or after changing conditions). Examples: 1) After I cooled down, I started to resweat when I put my jacket back on. 2) If you drink hot tea in summer, you may resweat quickly. 3) The workout was so intense that I resweat just walking home.
definition.zh: 再次出汗；在短暂休息后或条件变化后又开始出汗。例句：1）我刚凉下来，把外套穿回去就又开始出汗了。2）夏天喝热茶可能会很快又出汗。3）那次训练太猛了，我走回家都又出汗。

examples.en: After I cooled down, I started to resweat when I put my jacket back on.
examples.zh: 我刚凉下来，把外套穿回去就又开始出汗了。

examples.en: If you drink hot tea in summer, you may resweat quickly.
examples.zh: 夏天喝热茶可能会很快又出汗。

examples.en: The workout was so intense that I resweat just walking home.
examples.zh: 那次训练太猛了，我走回家都又出汗。

definition.en: (less common) to make something “sweat” again in a process—especially heating a material so oil, wax, moisture, or other substances come out. Examples: 1) The maker resweated the wax to remove bubbles. 2) Some leather is resweated to bring oils to the surface.
definition.zh: （较少见）让某物“再渗出/再出油/再出水”的加工步骤——通常指加热材料，使油脂、蜡、水分等再次析出。例句：1）工匠把蜡再加热“出汗”以去除气泡。2）有些皮革会被再次“出汗”处理，让油脂浮到表面。

examples.en: The maker resweated the wax to remove bubbles.
examples.zh: 工匠把蜡再加热“出汗”以去除气泡。

examples.en: Some leather is resweated to bring oils to the surface.
examples.zh: 有些皮革会被再次“出汗”处理，让油脂浮到表面。

extraExplanation: “resweat”不是常用词，更常见的写法是加连字符的 re-sweat（表示“再一次”）。日常英语里通常会说：start sweating again / sweat again。
第二个（工艺）义项偏专业，出现在材料加工语境中；这里的 “sweat” 是比喻用法，表示物质在加热时“渗出、析出”。

summary.en: Resweep means to sweep again, or (figuratively) to search an area again in a sweeping way.
summary.zh: resweep 指“再扫一遍”，也可引申为“再次大范围排查/搜查”。

definition.en: to sweep again; to clean a floor or surface a second time to remove remaining dust, dirt, or debris
definition.zh: 再扫一次；把地面或表面再清扫一遍，以清除残留的灰尘、污垢或碎屑

examples.en: There’s still sand by the door—please resweep that area.
examples.zh: 门口还有沙子——请把那一块再扫一遍。

examples.en: After the party, we reswept the kitchen to get rid of the last crumbs.
examples.zh: 派对结束后，我们把厨房又扫了一遍，把最后的面包屑清理干净。

definition.en: (figurative) to move through an area again in a wide, searching way, as if sweeping it (e.g., police, teams, or machines checking again)
definition.zh: （比喻）再次大范围搜索/排查某个区域（如警方、队伍或机器再检查一遍），像“扫过”一样

examples.en: The rescue team reswept the hillside at dawn, looking for any sign of the missing hiker.
examples.zh: 救援队在黎明时又把山坡重新搜了一遍，寻找失踪徒步者的任何线索。

examples.en: Investigators reswept the scene for overlooked evidence.
examples.zh: 调查人员对现场再次排查，以防漏掉证据。

extraExplanation: “resweep”通常写作 re-sweep 或 resweep，意思很直观：re-（再次）+ sweep（清扫/扫过）。在日常英语里更常见的说法是 “sweep again” 或 “go over it again”。
除了清洁语境外，它也可用于“再次搜查/扫描”的场景（如警方、救援、安检），带有“全面覆盖地再检查一遍”的感觉。

summary.en: “Resweeping” means sweeping again, or (figuratively) something sweeping through again.
summary.zh: “resweeping”表示“再次清扫”，也可比喻“再次席卷而来”。

definition.en: sweeping again; the act of sweeping a place a second time to remove remaining dirt or dust.
definition.zh: 再次清扫；把某个地方再扫一遍，以清除残留的灰尘或垃圾。

examples.en: After the party, I did some resweeping to get the crumbs under the table.
examples.zh: 聚会结束后，我又清扫了一遍，把桌子底下的面包屑扫干净。

examples.en: The hallway needed resweeping because people kept walking in with muddy shoes.
examples.zh: 走廊需要再扫一遍，因为大家一直穿着泥鞋走进来。

definition.en: moving or spreading across an area again in a broad, powerful way (often used figuratively).
definition.zh: （常为比喻）再次大范围地掠过、席卷。

examples.en: A strong wind came resweeping through the valley at night.
examples.zh: 夜里一阵强风再次席卷山谷。

examples.en: Old fears came resweeping back when she heard the news.
examples.zh: 她听到消息时，旧日的恐惧又一股脑地涌上心头。

extraExplanation: “resweeping”通常是动词“resweep”的现在分词/动名词形式：re-（再次）+ sweep（清扫/席卷）。写作中常用来强调“又来一遍”的动作或感觉。
如果你是在打扫语境里用，它多半就是“再扫一遍”；在文学或新闻语境里，也可能指风、情绪、潮流等“再次席卷而来”。

summary.en: Resweeten means to sweeten something again, literally (add sweetener again) or figuratively (make something pleasant again).
summary.zh: Resweeten 指“再次使变甜”，既可指实际再加甜味剂，也可比喻“让事情重新变得顺心/愉快”。

definition.en: to make something sweet again by adding sugar or another sweetener (often after it has become less sweet or after dilution).
definition.zh: （再次）使变甜；重新加糖/甜味剂使其变甜（常指变淡或被稀释后）。

examples.en: After adding more lemon juice, she had to resweeten the tea.
examples.zh: 加了更多柠檬汁后，她不得不把茶再加糖调甜。

examples.en: If the jam tastes too tart, resweeten it a little and cook for one more minute.
examples.zh: 如果果酱太酸，就稍微再加糖调甜，再煮一分钟。
